review_body: I rented a room in the Marina Towers for 2 nights prior to boarding the Pride of America. In 63 years I have had some bad experiences but none that top this one. When i rented it I did not realize it was a condo. I found it hard to locate and there wasNo one available to reach out to ask any questions. If you get a rental car plan to pay for parking. When the elevator does work it takes forever to get to you. The first night i stayed they shut the elevator down for the entire weekend and i Had to carry my luggage up and down to the 24th floor the entire time. Again no one on premises to reach out to. Once i got in the room the blankets and sheets were dirty...The AC didn't work... The TV didn't work... The Wifi didn't work... The window shades wouldn't pull down...The Windows allowed air to pass through creating a whistle sound the whole night and again no one available to get anything working. They will take your money and from there your on your own. I wouldn't recommend this dump to my worst enemy. BUYER BEWARE!!!

We had to change our booking last minute and ended up in this hell hole. When I booked online it was for room 2804. When we arrived we ended up in room 3504. I’ve attached photos. This place is a dump. We had stained towels, blood stains on the mattress, broken cupboards and filthy cutlery. For the first week the elevator worked then they turned it off due to high winds. Ironically the hotel in front of ours still has all of theirs running. Being on the 35th floor with bad knees and ankles and a partner who bodyboards climbing 35 floors was horrifying. It completely destroyed our holiday as our first trip to Hawaii and our first holiday as a couple. If you book this place your nuts!!! Whilst here we have tried many times to seek a refund through Airbnb but they are useless.

Terrible place!!!! Don't rent here the elevators not workin!!! 0 elevators all the time and youll walk the stairs 30-40 floors! Cant park in loading zone they'll tow your car and not be responsible for it!!!

Why has this place not been shut down yet ?The rooms are filthy, not only mine but also from the other guests I met on the stairways because none of the elevators where working.The toilet bowl and shower, the floors and the bedding where very dirty and stained.The sheet on top of the mattress had a blood and urine stain in the size of a dinner plate, than covered with another sheet.The worst accommodation ever. I have traveled the world in economy and luxury places .Even third world countries showed more respect and pride to a traveler.The elevator worked one time but kept on dropping between floors, it is outride dangerous.I tried to get part of my money back but the management refused. The location is the only good thing about this place.

We were in the Best Western on business during Christmas but needed another night's stay before our flight on the 28th and Best Western wasn't available. It would appear that the New Year is prime time to visit Hawaii. After searching TripAdvisor, I came across this place. I read reviews, good and bad, with the main complaint being the elevator. So, reluctantly, I booked it for the one night (not to mention, our $300+ price was cheaper than the almost $1000 price for other places - and there weren't that many choices). First, there is no early check in, even though instructions said you could ask. So, precisely at 4pm, we got in to our room. The TV was on (we figured that was because the remote didn't work most of the time). As I entered the door to the room, I noticed a cabinet door ajar. I went to shut it to keep from hitting my head upon entering. It was open because it wouldn't stay closed. Once we got in to the room, I put one of our bags on the bed. I've seen trampolines with less bounce. And throughout the night, every time one of us moved, it almost launched the other one. Needless to say, we got very little sleep. While looking the place over, I noticed the faucet in the shower leaked. Also, the first time we washed our hands in the bathroom sink, it became apparently clear that it was clogged. It took hours to drain. Also, when I went to throw something away, I discovered the cabinet door hiding the trash can in the "kitchenette" was loose and almost fell off (it was being held by one hinge). As for the elevator, I do believe I read reviews from a couple of years back with guests complaining about the elevator ( just how long doesn't take to fix an elevator?). When we checked in, there was one of the two elevators working, so, yes, we had a long wait. Thankfully, we had to leave before sunrise, so the elevator wasn't too much of a problem. Also, since we did leave before sunrise, we discovered that there are no lights in the tight, small parking garage, so you might want to make sure you have a flashlight. We stayed here because there were few choices, but I wonder if we would have been just as comfortable sleeping in our Jeep.

DO NOT BOOK THIS PROPERTY, it is a nightmare, elevators have been shutdown for our entire stay have to climb 38 floors in stairwell that is littered with garbage and urine, with no airflow. According to live in residents there is no budget or timeline to fix the elevators. Only plus side is the view if you have ocean view room, but that alone is not worth it, save yourself the headache and book elsewhere.

The images I have attached pretty much sum it up. I am considering filling a formal complaint with the consumer protection of the state of Hawaii.Here are some of the main issues we encountered:Sheets, pillow cases, and towels were all heavily stained. I found nail clippings and hair on the sheet. Even the fridge had not been emptied! The toilet bowl was very dirty. The shower was moldy, and the shower drain was clogged.I sent the same pictures I have accompanied with this review in an email and also a few text messages to their management, but have not received any response yet (a week after we checked out). We ended up calling them to just get clean sheets and towels.We happened to be in the unit when someone finally showed up to replace the stained sheets and towels. The person struggled with finding clean sheets: He went through four sheets until he finally found a clean one. Even he himself was surprised!We had not been told about the situation with the elevator (45 minute wait time as in the notice in one of the images). The building has two elevators and for a period during our stay both were down. We had to take the stairs. The unit we stayed at was on the 29th floor.The broken door handles of the microwave and the fridge, and the use of two twin mattresses instead of a queen or king mattress (see the images) indicate how poorly maintained this place is. DO NOT BOOK WITH MARINA TOWER WAIKIKI!

We love waikiki and the views were absolutely breathtaking from the 36th floor condo. the owner of the condo was excellent to work with as well. we stayed in 3603 and i would highly recommend the actual condo itself.The elevators are another story.We had a special dinner planned and, since I am so uber famous, felt it necessary to have my hair and make up done. I return to the building to go up and get dressed and on the way up- alone-(because Im fancy like that and had my own private elevator- aka no one else was dumb enough to get on said elevator) the elevator stopped. On the 30th floor. after 15 minutes of crying screaming for help -sweating off the miracle make up job some poor lady did to my face...the lights go out and the elevator slips down a few feet so im now stuck staring at the all between the 29thand 30th floors. I have never had anxiety or a panic attack of any sort since Prince died and im afraid that evening i did. That or I just peed my pants- who knows.People were trying to help, no one could get the doors open but the fire department came and after 40 minutes and six firemen later(SIX firemen, ladies. you read that right) they were able to wedge the door open so i could be pulled out. Ive never wanted to grab a fireman so badly. or have I. But my boyfriend was there and naturally my first option for an ab grab. I hate to leave a bad review as the owner of the condo is wonderful, but I had to walk up and down 36 flights of stairs the remainder of our trip anytime I came and went, which I am sure sounds like a dream if you're a CrossFit junkie which I am not. plus side i now have a butt the Kardashians would envy and I slept like a baby on the red eye home which made for a quiet and relaxing return flight for the boyfriend.

If you are thinking of staying here, think again.It is the most disgusting place I have ever stayed in. We had prepaid this room and as they have no check in counter (not suprised as they would have a constant line up of people complaining) we had to check in on line. The following day we noticed that there had been approx 5 seperate chargers on my friends credit card from Marina Towers totalling over $1000. They are theives. We got our travel agent to try and sort this out and two weeks later we still are waiting to receive the full amount back as promised. When we arrived to the room on the 39th floor in the shaky glass elevator that only one of two were working we were so gutted to see the room was filth. The toilet hadn't been cleaned, there was hardly any toilet paper left on the roll, the shower looked like it hadn't been cleaned in years. Soap scum and mould everywhere.. The kitchen was a disgrace. The sheets were stained and the pillows were completely yellow . We had to arrange to have the room cleaned the following day. I've stayed in some older, basic hotels before but this was next level. We were then told that maybe our expectations were too high. Not sure that having a room cleaned before arrival is much of an expectation. We wore our shoes the whole time as we were scared to walk on the carpet, the lounge chair was also heavily stained. I was really looking forward to staying in Waikiki as it was my first time to Hawaii and this experience really ruined it for me. Since being home I have searched around and there are so many other options of places to stay for the same money we wasted on this place. So disappointed.

We unfortunately booked this hotel without first reading the reviews as I was in a bit of a rush at the time. I wish I had of read the reviews because I can tell you, they’re all true, it’s an awful place to stay and very very unorganised. From the moment we arrived we had problems. Had to wait 4 hours before being let into our room even after emailing the hotel a week prior to our stay that we would be arriving at 8am and would like to check in early or at least drop our bags. There was nobody in sight and when I called the number for the hotel nobody answered. We luckily found a cleaner who stored our bags away for us and then we went for a walk to the nearby shopping centre and had to kill a few hours after our 11 hour flight. Finally, we got into our room... I don’t think it has been updated since first being built, tiles were lifting, the carpet was heavily stained, bathroom was disgusting and the light in there did not work. If you want to take the elevator to your room. Depending on what floor you’re staying on, it could take up to 40 mins to get there as only 1 elevator is in operation for the 40 odd floors. During the middle of our stay, even that elevator broke down and we had to walk up 15 levels each time to get to and from our hotelWhen we checked out, we got to the airport and realised we had left our vape (e-cigarette) in our room. So I quickly emailed the hotel before our flight to let them know as room service would not yet have been into our room. I was hoping they could get it for us. I asked if they could post it and I would send them the money for postage or even just let us know if it is there and we would arrange pickup from a friend. Never heard back from them. Tried to call them, no answer. Please, do yourself a favour and don’t make the same mistake that we did.... do not stay here! Hopefully this review saves someone’s time.

I booked this place at the last minute as I didn’t account for the International Date Lune (were from Australia) and we needed 1 night’s accommodation before our hotel was expecting us. I booked the marina towers as it was nearby our other hotel. What a terrible mistake!!Check in was a nightmare - there is no reception and the confirmation email I received had the wrong dates on it so I replied advising of their mistake. By the time the replied with the correct dates we were already in transit. Our flight arrived at 8am however we were advised that our room wouldn’t be ready till 4pm. Thank goodness we were able to store our luggage for the next 8 hours. We said we would be happy to pay extra for early check in however I never received a reply to this request. Finally we were granted access to our room. Positive - the room has an amazing view. Negative - the room is VERY dated - but the worst thing is the bathroom!! See pictures of DIRT and MOULD!!! Yuk!!! DO NOT STAY IN IN ROOM 3702!!!!!

Do NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. May I suggest the Aqua Palms down the road around the same price much better hotel. Neither elevator worked and they had us on the 37th floor. I think not.... they’ve been working on them for months and have no ETA.

TNOe apartment in the tower was neat and clean and essentials were supplied, bedding, towels, shampoo, soap etc. The view was fantastic.The apartment itself contained air conditioner. The AC unit was LOUD, we were supplied with earplugs. As there were no fans, it was definitely a requirement to have the AC on for cooling. If you are a light sleeper, do NOT stay here!The window that opened contained NO child safety latches or barriers. The ledge outside the window also had NO safety barrier. It would be easy for a toddler or child to climb out onto the ledge from an open window and accidentally step over the ledge and fall to the ground. This would also be the case for substance impacted adults. If you have yound children reconsider this location as an accommodation option. One of the only two lifts was out of service, comments made by others suggested it may have been like that for months or years.The wplromg ;oft bprle dpwm during out stay requiring it to be out of action fro several hours and occumpants needing to use the stairs to go up and down the 40 storey building.

When we got here one elevator was working and today this morning we where waiting for it and it didn’t come and we went down the stairs and tonight we came back we saw people waiting and they said it’s stuck on the 17th flor for 30 mins and we had to walk up to the 31 first floor ether gives us our money back our fix the elevator.

We booked 8 nights at this establishment so not a hotel it’s a private condo that we booked through a third party site. What can I say the location was good but that’s where it ended. No room service at all so no clean sheets even after asking. There was not even a mattress protector on the bed or pillow protectors it was so gross. Not a very clean room extremely dated. There was only 1 working elevator on any day during our stay and one even that broke and we waited 3.5 hrs to get back to our room on the 35th floor. Ridiculous that resort fees were charged. Please find somewhere else to stay spend the extra $1000 you won’t be sorry. Picture of view from room only reason they can charge more than $50.

We stayed in a small Airbnb studio. Instructions were very clear on how to get the room. Very spacious for two people and clean all round. Great view. Furniture in good shape, full fridge, couple of cosmetic issues of ceiling lights had no light bulbs the light fixture in shower was busted a little nervous of bulbs being exposed and could see the very dirty fan. One elevator out so waiting time was long at times. Pool was clean and lovely. Could use more chairs for such a big building. 5 loungers available. BBQ if you want to BBQ. Walking distance to shopping and restaurants. Also walking distance to the beach. ( picture of room is similar to what we stayed in. ).

They let us check in at 2pm instead of 4 because we were waiting for a long time. We werent too sure about the hotel because of some comments about bugs and the cleanliness but to us, it wasnt an issue! The room was perfect for our needs and very well located. The pool is fine too.

We got a room on the 37th floor, from where the huge window offered a breath-taking view.Furniture is a bit dated, but the exceptional customer service received from Chris honestly makes up for the defects.Location is excellent, approx 5 minutes walk to Ala Moana shopping centre and 15 minutes walk to Waikiki shopping street with tons of rstaurants to chose from. Cleanliness could be improved.

I made a reservation through AirBnB without knowing there was an issue with the elevator. The host assured me it won't be a problem so I kept the reservation,,,big mistake. Only one small, slow and shaky elevator was servicing this 40-story building. We had to wait for a long time every time and it caused delays, anxiety, and disappointment. The unit itself was nice with great view of ocean but this elevator situation nearly ruined our trip. I felt bad for other 2 people I was traveling with. Flying all the way from NYC and that's not what we wanted to deal with. I'm asking the host for some refund, he was not being truthful and even with the discount it was not worth the money I paid.I suggest you all find better accommodation. Everyone we ran into in the elevator was complaining.

review_body: The rooms here are mediocre. Not very clean looking. Other than the scenic view of the city. This place hasn't much to offer. Only one elevator worked and it took for ever to come to your floor. Supposedly, their supposed to be remodeling. I didnt see a contractor work during the week or weekend. They charge you a resort fee. Other than the pool, there's no complimentary breakfast, no room service, and other amenities that come along with resort fees. They even charge a $3 fee for using the rooms safe. I wouldn't plan on staying here again.

Hotel was booked for free after attending time share presentation. The place looked nice on the outside but I knew something was terribly wrong when we had to check outside in the parking out. Room looked like a cheap motel 6. Two twin beds where out together to make a queen. The bed would split while sleeping. No house keeper, no trash can in room. Beds onlyHad a thin sheet to keep us warm. Pillows were so hard and uncomfortable. The bed was even harder. You can feel the mattress springs. Elevator never worked. When it si we had to wait 20-30 mins. Sometimes it was just faster to walk up the 20 flights of stairs then wait and risk the elevator being too full to fit in. Pool was tiny. Parking was expensive $30 a night. You are given two towels. No new towels. They did have microwave and refrigerator and sink. The only good thing about the entire stay. T.v also would loose single And it would be out for hours.overall I wish I would have paid then to stay here.

Location was decentRoom was not that comfyCustomer service was the worst I have ever experienced on a trip to waikiki. It was like they could not care less I'd we were to be return customers or not. Horrible.

We stayed ere for free after attending a time share meeting. We stayed one week, reading previous reviews, I packed my own towels, and bedding. Bought cleaning supplies from a target down the way, aside from that, the views are spectacular, they allowed us to store luggage both before and after checking, and check out. Late check out had a charge, so we left before. The building is secure, there’s a refrigerator, a stove, microwave. Aside from cleaning it down myself, can not complain, the prices out here are ridiculous, there’s also a washer and dryer, used bleach on my first load, then regular wash after. Conveniently located from pick up locations for tours, an abc store and mic Donald’s on the Conner, and the largest outdoor shopping center ( with a target) walking distance. Only used the room to sleep from 11pm- 6am then explored the ideal and with alll the money saved. I sucked it up! And spent money on exploring the island.

We live in Waikiki and had two groups of family & friends book this hotel for their stay. The only redeeming part of the stay was the view and the location. The rooms were unacceptable—not clean & no bedding provided fir all the beds. But most importantly is the fact that the elevators were not working properly the entire stay. Waits of 45 minutes not uncommon & several times no elevator was working. This is a serious safety issue that should be addressed by authorities immediately.

Spend a a bit more money and stay somewhere else. This place is Gross and disgusting. Sheets had stains and pillow cases had hair on it. Room was not clean at all. That was the 1st room. We then moved to a second room. It was much better because the bedding was clean. But, the floor was filthy and had some sticky liquid spilled on some area's which left shoe marks all over. Housekeeping did not clean in back of night stand. We saw in horror a broken coffee cup and a hair ball collection of every guess that stayed in that room. Worse part is only one elevator is working. Some one pulled the Alarm residence and guest had to walk down a narrow smelly stairwell. This place is 40 stories high. If you're a senior citizen please stay somewhere else. This place will kill you.

View of the Ocean as far as you could see, snake in the middle of Waikiki beach and the Ala Moana centre, clean tidy and kitchen well worth it..Lifts a little slow but we weren’t in a hurry!!Heading back there in June can’t wait

This is the worst hotel room I have been in during the past 17 years. I average 230+ hotel rooms per year. Room is dirty, outdated, dark, counters and range top greasy, walls crumbling, floors filthy.

Alright, before I get into what made my ‘holiday’ horrific I will start with a positive (the only positive).... the view from the 35th floor was fantastic from a ‘hotel’ that’s not directly on the beach.I stayed at this property from December 23rd- Hawaiian Christmas yay! Not so yay..... the property has 2 elevators, one was still under construction (according to signage) and one was working....for about 12 hours and then there was not any elevators. Picture me, walking up over 500 steps just to get to the room and another 500 steps to get down to the lobby level.....needless to say, it was sweaty work and stinky as there was no ventilation and people were leaving their rubbish bags in the stairwells.We were told they would be fixed and during the stay the sign was updated 3 times saying they are still down....My paradise turned into an episode of Faulty Towers....To make matters worse, we were informed that because we were staying for 10 nights, our room would be serviced after the 6th night.....it wasn’t.....we spoke to the same lady 3 days in a row who lied to our faces saying it would be done.....it wasn’t.Ultimately due to Christmas and New Years, we were stuck at Faulty Towers....after 8 nights we got out and managed to find alternate accommodation. It took the two of us (with 3 suitcases) 47 minutes to get down.I adore Hawaii and it sucks that this place ruined my holiday.In terms of the room, it had stains and cracks in the ceiling, stains on the sheets upon check in, and dirty carpet.It’s hostel quality.As I mentioned at the beginning, the view was incredible, however I will add that the windows open giving you about a metre or more of open space and there is no barrier to keep you in, if you have children it would be a BIG safety concern.I spoke to an elderly resident who owns in this building and she had to go and book a hotel until the elevator works as she can’t do the stairs..... it’s not ok ....Beware of hotel deals and read reviews, lesson learnt.....

Well, every now and then if one travels enough, you will book a terrible place. That place is the Waikiki Marina Tower. It was built in 1984. When you enter the property you will be magically transported back to that era (No time machine needed). We rented a corner condo on the 23rd floor. Our first, and only, time that the elevator worked took thirty minutes to get to our floor. The old building is being "renovated", although there are no signs of work being done. The one working elevator gave up the ghost at some point that night. We had to walk down 23 flights of steps to go out the next morning. The tiny condo had been remodeled inside but was still in need of serious work. The local bugs seemed to enjoy the spread more than we did.Any time that we went out, it was 23 flights down and 23 flights back up. When we went to leave, we had to tote all of our luggage down to the street. Yup, 23 more flights of fun!!!I think that effectively sums things up.

First of all they will whoever is running the check in desk (which is in the parking garage) will write down all your credit card information on a piece of paper and stick it in a pile with the others (when you get home, don't forget to call your credit card company and get a new card) then they stick you with a $200 security deposit that isn't even on the Agoda website. Then there is only 1 elevator that is serving 40 floors. The wait was awful most of the time. They say that's because the building is under renovation but I didn't see anything being renovated. The room itself is ghetto with peeling paint in the bathroom. Luckily the carpet was clean but the sheets were not. Forget trying to get new linens either. Management is only onsite at night time starting at 9:30pm. The only good thing about the room I had was that it faced the ocean through a nice big window. I'll never stay here again!!

First of all- The “king size”bed is just two flimsy twins pushed together. No fitted sheet. I’ve been here a week and nobody has come to my room to take out the trash or tidy up. There’s cockroaches. The staff is super unhelpful and rude. I forgot to take my key with me and they charged me $25 for someone to let me back into my room! All someone had to do was take the elevator up and let me in! I will never ever stay here again and I will advise others to do the same.

The list is long but let’s start with the disgusting rooms that smell horrid are run down and falling apart, dirty mouldy bathrooms and wet sticky carpet.(don’t take your shoes off) staff are unhelpful and rude and reception , if your lucky enough to catch them in is in the car park. We were charged an extra $15 us a day as a resort fee ha no mention of that when we booked and paid in advance. Then a $200 us credit card hold on my credit card for the key. No maid service unless you pay an extra $50 us a day. Day 4 we asked for clean towels we finally got them day 6. View was ok but don’t open the window because the questionable substance on the sill and ledge was lumpy and smelly. There are 2 elevators when we booked in only one was working the other had to service 36 floors of the property and some times the wait was up to 45 mins. But when we left there was no working elevators so we had to carry our luggage down 10 flights of stairs with no assistance from the non existent staff. In summary don’t ruin your holiday take your money and go somewhere else.

We have just returned from staying at a privately owned apartment in this complex. Great value for money and a great owner to deal with. Not 5 star and it isn’t advertised as such but comfortable and handy to everything. If you read the reviews on the elevators..believe them. One over worked elevator servicing 40 floors. No maximum people rating or maximum weight rating. A real safety issue in my view. A sign in the lobby says the other elevator is undergoing major renovations due for completion 2019. In seven days we saw no sign of any work being undertaken at all. Previous reviews indicate this elevator issue is not new. To top it off on our departure day no elevators were working and we were forced to navigate 30 floors via the stairwell with all of our baggage at 5.30am in the morning. If you are elderly , unfit or nervous in elevators this is not for you.

I booked a hotel for my sister and her boyfriend for their holiday on Oahu. I was very disappointed in seeing this room.Check in with "reception" outside on a fold up table. Wait for the elevator for a lloooonnnggg time. One elevator is broken. Second elevator is really busy and slooooowww for 40 floors. The actual room is dirty and gross. EVERYTHING needs updating. Stained lamps. Patched wall in the bathroom needs proper fix. Mold in the bathroom. Dishes in the kitchenette were dirty. Replace hard bed. Tiny closet needs cleaning and hangers. Window probably should not be able to open so wide (being on the 27th floor). Steps in the stairwell are not deep enough for size 10 shoe size mens. No sound proofing.Great view of marina.Good walk-able location.Good hot tub.Staff need lessons in customer service (not from our experience but what we saw with others).

If you are staying in Honolulu for a couple days or more on business, I highly recommend this place. It is also good for couples looking for a decent place without breaking the bank. It is more practical and functional than fancy. But I am one to spend my money on excursions than sleeping arrangements. Nice little kitchenette, great view, pool, and walking distance to Hawaiian Hilton. Plus the staff is very friendly.

Like some other reviews if I could give a 0 rating, I would. We had 9 days in Waikiki before boarding the cruise ship Norwegian Cruise Line. The cruise was reduced to five days due to Hurricane Lane. We arrived back in Port on the 1st September and had to be off the ship by 9am. We caught a taxi to the Marina Towers. Knowing that we would be too early to book in, we thought we would store our luggage and do another tour, to fill in the day. We arrived at the Hotel, only to find we couldn't get in and there was no Reception Counter. Finally, after speaking to other guests, who had already booked in, they told us a lady was coming down and to speak to her. She was not very helpful at all, mind you she did seem flustered. After a very long wait we finally managed to have our luggage stored. Our confirmation letter did not have a book-in time on it, so we were amazed to hear it was 4pm. We were booked in on a table in the car park. One positive was, we did manage to get in a little earlier because our room was ready. The room was in need of a lot of attention. The cupboards in the kitchen were falling apart, the air conditioner was so noisy, my husband could not sleep and the computer boxes and wires were exposed and just sitting on the floor near the bed. I was in the bathroom at the sink, when the cover over the light fell down and almost hit me. The signs on the lift were confusing saying only one was working, but at times both seemed to be working. The cleaner was there ready to clean before we even left the room just after 10am. We had to wait down stairs for almost an hour because the signs on the lift said not to leave it until the last minute. I realised I had left several pieces of clothing behind after washing and not putting certain items in the dryer. The cupboard I put them in would not stay open when you wanted to leave the room. Hence I forgot to collect them. So it turned out to be a very expensive stay. $200 USD was taken from our credit card and was to be refunded. At this time it still has not been refunded. So many other people were complaining about the cost of parking and not being able to access the complex. NO RECEPTION DESK AND NO TOUR DESK. So sorry we didn't go back to the Hotel we stayed in at the beginning of our holiday and it was cheaper than Marina Towers. Thank goodness we were only there for one night before flying back home.

We stayed here twice. First time was in 2014 and told ourselves we would never stay here again because of the moldy showers, slow (one working) elevator, and the bad parking situation. Then just recently we booked a last minute stay in Waikiki and I was lured by the price. Worst. Decision. Ever. We pulled up and realized this was the same crappy condo we stayed at 4 years ago but surely the elevators are fixed right? WRONG! One elevator, 40 floors. Our room was better this time around, shower wasn’t moldy, you could just see the bleach stains, lols. But this time the internet isn’t working. Which is worse than having mold in this day and age. I booked a different hotel for our 2nd night. Luckily we only booked 2 nights so I’m only out of pocket 1 night stay but learn from me and just pay the extra money the first time around!!! This 2nd night in Waikiki is now gonna cost me >$300 because I have to pay for our room here and the new hotel. Don’t do it!!!

Just in for an 8-hour plane layover. Wanted a shower and base. Rented because of Waikiki name and price. This place is outdated, smelly, and run-down. I should have suspected at the so called checkin, which was not a nice experience. As you see the building, it is many floors.There are four "apartments" per floor. And only ONE working elevator which was very slow going. Pay more and avoid this flea-bag.

If I could leave a 0 star review I would. Guys yes this might be a cheap hotel and sound good, but don’t get it. You guys will definitely regret it. Pay an extra $500 and it will be much worth. They charge to just open a door if you get urself locked out. When we checked in we were told that our room will be cleaned every 5th day. When 5th day came no one cleaned. I called the number and they said they will clean today. Later she texted me and shaid their short on staff and cleaning will happen tomorrow. Horrible elevator. Riding the elevator u feel like you will fall down any minute. Makes horrible noises and such. It’s horrible service. They will not check u in earlier then 4pm. They will not answer phones till 10:30am no matter what emergency it is. Horrible horrible services. Rooms are nasty and durty and very smelly. I every day wanted to cancel the reservation. I rather spent a bit more and be in peace on vacation.

I recently stayed in a room with my wife, and I would like to share a few observations with you about our experience. Early in February we narrowed our choices to Marina Towers Waikiki & one other. It was a very tough call, but Marina edged out over the other simply because of the ocean view.When we arrived, we had time to kill. There were no lockers to store luggage but valets allowed us to keep our luggage in their storage. So we killed time & returned at 3:30 for a 4PM for check in. However it took 60 minutes before anyone showed up to do the check-in. The ladies that check us in weren't the friendliest and seemed to be annoyed that they had to do it. The lady that did check us in asked for ID, my wife handed her Japanese ID to her only for the lady to say, No, your passport - which she should've asked for to begin with. By the time the elevators were working and we got in the room it was 5PM. Let me point out that this is what their website states: Elevator Renovation - Marina Tower Waikiki is undergoing an elevator renovation and MAY only have 1 elevator operational during work. You may have noticed that I capitalized 'may', this is because it is the key-word in that statement on their website. May is VERY misleading because it means expressing possibility. There was no possibility there, 1 elevator was operational the entire length of our stay. There was no mention either of the nice notice hanging by the elevators either, stating that it may take up to 45 minutes for a single elevator to reach all floors. Also, mentioned taking the stairs... we were on the 37th floor!!! It got stuck once and we had to walk down 20 floors. I have been in elevators a lot older than the ones at Marina Tower that I felt safer in.The view from the room was spectacular too bad the room wasn't. The stove didn't work. Well, half of it did but it was a little difficult to get working. There were little bugs around both sinks. The shower floor felt slimey there was mould around the edges. It was a little windy while we were there and the wind howled through or window. The window was closed, but the noise came from the furthest left side of the window, where it cannot be opened. The staff... well, what staff we actually saw and met, for the most part, seemed to be inconvenienced by being asked questions. Even the security person outside wasn't very friendly. I actually pointed out the "office" to someone that had questions, because a lady was inside. The lady then brought the person outside, pointed at the piece of paper on the wall saying, "That's the office number. You have to call them. This isn't the office!" It was if she was upset that either A: she had to actually speak to someone or B: because I pointed out where the "not-the-office" was. The friendliest staff member we met was the cleaning lady; she was actually very friendly and helpful.The last night there, I had to arrange for our ride to the airport, so I had to call someone for a pick up. For the 1st time, I picked up the phone in the hotel room... nothing... wait, I did hear something... music? Very low music, almost like I was on hold for someone. I pushed the buttons but got no tone, everything was plugged in & it should've been working. I checked again, but still only the low music playing. I should point out that the "office hours" until around 10 or 11 PM. I don't recall the exact hours, but the office was still open. When I went downstairs to the "not the office" door. The light was on but nobody was inside. I knocked but nothing. I only saw someone at the security desk 3 times in the 4 nights we stayed there. I asked where the nearest payphone was, she said across the street by the lights. Surprise, she was wrong. Yes, I did confirm everything she told me but, still wrong. I had to go searching for a phonebooth since our didn't work. Thankfully, I found one at another hotel. I will say this for Marina Tower Waikiki. The view is great, no question there. The location is also great because a lot of places can easily be walked too. However since there are a number of other places close by, I would never recommend anyone ever stay at Marina Towers Waikiki. The experience through Marina Towers Waikiki is one I will never forget, because it was so bad.

We thought we would try an AirBnB since we are looking to retire and travel more. Wondering what a condo type rental would be. Didn't know what to expect but it was not this. Even though an efficiency I did expect some type of dresser not just a couple drawers in a newly updated vanity in the bath. We were ther 10 days and had to empty the kitchen drawers for storage. In addition we were given adequate hangers however none had a bar to hang pants or a skirt. We had to drape them across the only chair in the room. We did find out this is s condo hotel so there is some type of association.The building is tall and narrow. 40 floors with 4 units on each floor. As far as I know there was only one floor with laundry facilities and 2 of the washers were out of service. A sign stated they would be prepared the following month. It appears they were I. The process of changing they system. We were informed 2 days before we were to leave that one of the elevators was not working and we could cancel or our host would give us a reduced rate.. Since it was so late we accepted. After reading other posts not on the AirBnB site it appears it has been out of service since at least last Oct and wil be until into 2019. It appears we had not been told the truth from the beginning.The room had been redone and was clean. We were concerned that the bed be extra firm since back issues are very real problem. While the mattress appeared new it was definitely not firm.Finally one night while sleeping at about 3:30 am the fire alarm went off for about a minute or two and then stopped. About 15-20 people climbed down the stairs and found no security (who we learned leaves at 3 am) and no fire dept. We called 911 and the fire dept asked US if it was an emergency! Without coming out they somehow determined it was a false alarm. Strangest thing ever! The day were were leaving a sign was posted noted pest control was arriving on Thursday. Any unit desiring their service could pay $10. I hope it was not going to be a guest. We did see 2 small bugs early on and that is all.I would choose another place.

We booked our trip through Expedia. Lets start off by saying the rooms look NOTHING like the picture posted. When we arrived the lady was very nice; she alerted us that both elevators were down so she could either credit our card so we could look for a different hotel or we would have to use the stairs (keep in mind other reviews say this happens a lot and its a 40 story building). The mall & beach are both within a 10 min walking distance.

I booked through Expedia and stayed in 1404 (currently still here). I did read the reviews and they were helpful in making sure I understood all issues. I was a bit freaked out as I had no idea what I was walking into. First I have to say, these are all the items you need to know upfront:If you want to check in late: you need to call the manager at 808-952-5200. They will direct you to your lockbox located on the right of the building where you will get your FOB and keycard. You will need to ask what the wifi password is, as I didn't have that in my room.IF you do check in late, you MUST register with the lady the following day between her hours to get your card re-activated, give her your credit card and ID.Checkin is in the outside lobby between 3-5pm. She is wearing a blue shirt. I found her very nice and accommodating. Sure it's in the garage, but it's nicely done up and I didn't feel at all any security issues in the evening. The room. I did book a deluxe ocean view room and I do have a nice view of that., but it's not the view I would get if I was on the 25th floor and above. I AM rather thankful it isn't on the 25 floor or above as the elevators would be a bit long. I had NO issues with elevators at any point. Both were running. There has been no longer than a 3-4 minute wait. I have waited longer at the Hilton.There is a $10 resort fee. Really not sure why...but it is what it is.My room was very clean, hardwood floors and fairly new kitchen/bathroom. The bed was actually quiet comfortable!Look it's not the Hilton or Sheraton...but I certainly wouldn't put it as a 2 star. Considering I paid $120 canadian with a full kitchen in Waikiki, I got a great deal. The beach is a 10 minute walk to the Fort Derussy Park beach (which happens to be my all time favourite part of the entire beach).I feel that some of the reviews may have merit, but I also feel many people didn't read the instructions either and each booking company has different rooms. If you do decide to book, call the lady at the number, tell her what booking agent you are using as she can tell you if your room is a sheit one or a good one. Remember booking via AirBNB or VRBO you could very well end up with a "locals" room and you have no idea what state it might be in. KIki

This place was ridiculous! NO FRONT DESK. NOTHING. you have to call to let the person know your here. THEN they charge you at $10 RESORT FEE. Yet expedia failed to mention that. I have been travelling all over the world for 34 years and have never stayed in a worse hotel in my life. Don't get me wrong, I have stayed in various places, from backpackers to 1-5 star rated resorts, but at least I knew what I was getting. This hotel is crap and way too expensive for what you get. Firstly the shuttle driver from the airport had to google it as he had not heard of it. It is on the far end of Waikiki so to get anywhere worthwhile, is a good 10 minute walk. No foyer/concierge, they meet you out the front to check you in. No tour desk. Only one elevator in use as the other one is being refurbished. Was out of action for an extremely long time. They have a sign up, apologising for this and state it may take 45 minutes for the one elevator to reach all floors. I did not have to wait 45 minutes, I would say 15 minutes was the norm. This made you limit how often you came and went. I also tried to stay out as long as possible as I am a smoker and to go out to have a cigarette, with only one elevator working, was just not feasible. To my surprise, in July I received an email stating I would be charged US$10 a day for resort fees. This was not stated to me when I made and fully paid for the booking in November, 2016. I booked through booking.com. So another US$40 more for 'resort fees' for the four nights. Resort?? What an absolute joke!! A tennis court, spa and small pool that was so overshadowed by trees, I had to go to the beach to soak up the sun. Alas, I did not use the 'resort'. I booked a deluxe room. My god, I would hate to see what their standard rooms are like. I looked into my neighbours room, who supposedly had the same room as me. Well theirs was completely different, much nicer and updated. Got me thinking that maybe the rooms are privately owned and that could explain the variations. I also believe this is a place where people actually live and are not just tourists/visitors. Not that there is anything wrong with that, it seems like the place just 'exists', with no upkeep but collecting a lot of money. My room was dirty with black strands of hair everywhere. So many things needed maintenance, I can't list them all. There was not even a 'tea towel' in the kitchenette. How are you meant to dry your dishes? When I got home I had to supply booking.com with the evidence of the extra US$40 charged that I was not made a where of when I booked. Took a few weeks but I got my money back. Worst experience ever. DO NOT STAY THERE.

The place had an awesome view. The room was somewhat clean. However, there was a smell when you entered that took a bit to get used to. But the service was lovely and we only used it to sleep in. So it was perfect.

This had to be one of the two worst places I have ever stayed. The room was dirty, there was mold in the bathroom and the countertops had giant cracks in them that were poorly patched. So needless to say we called Expedia and got it fixed and put our Hotel winners up in a nicer Hotel one block away. Not the way I wanted to spend my first three hours in Hawaii. Never again will I deal with this place. I highly recommend everyone to take your business elsewhere. Oh and if it would have let me, I wouldn't have rated it at all.

I know there are plenty of reviews saying how bad this hotel is but it honestly isn't that bad for how much it costs. The cheapest one we found so we weren't expecting it to be great. All we needed was a place to sleep and shower. Bed was okay, two singles pushed together but was the size of a king. The toilet was placed really weirdly and the shower not much pressure. Kitchen with everything you needed. Overall the room was fine and was what you would expect for something cheap. It also said check in would not be until 4pm and we arrived at about 10am so the Equus happily held our bags while we went and explored. Came back at 12pm and our room was ready, so that was great because we really needed a shower after our long flight. There was someone there to check us in and she was very friendly. The elevators are the worst part, sometimes only one worked and you had to wait a bit but they have notices about it so you are aware. The hotel is very close to everything so the location is great. Overall, wasn't as bad as other reviews made it out to be and it did us just fine

We were booked for 10 nights but could not stay one, bathroom was disgusting and filthy my partner refused to use shower, we met the agent in the car park to get the keys ,looked at the room , then went looking for agent to complain, she had gone, after several phone calls we were told there was nothing we could till next day, when the office was open, we were nog given tge address of the office ,we went to another hotel for the nightNever Never book this place it will ruin your vacation

This place is a disgrace!!! Heed my warning please! Avoid this place but if you do end up here and you're given room 1002 change IMMEDIATELY.There is no reception to check in. Luckily we arrived just before "someone" turned up with all the keys and info for guests at 5pm. Some poor fellow traveller had been waiting from 10am to know what was going on. If your in this situation there is a phone number that no one answers and literally no other info. Try talking to the valet boys for Equus for direction or Next door the trade winds might (unlikely) help.Instructions verbally told to us contradicted the sheet given to us about what to do on check out. If you have unfortunately booked this place leave the fob and keys in your room on checkout. Regardless of what the sheet says. The room (1002) was a disgrace. It stank and I mean overwhelmingly reeked. The Wi-Fi password was wrong but worked on other room numbers (Wi-Fi is linked to each room). The toilet, was impractically placed and virtually useless. Furthermore the whole thing moved when you sat down and you need to be a contortionist to actually use the roll holder. The shower was what stank and the soap was not cleaned out from God knows when see my photos attached. Naturally we raced downstairs to complain/change rooms but lo and behold the "receptionist" had vanished already. Called the numbers given and no one answered, for three days. Don't bother asking any of the residents there. They are about as useful as a box of hair and lack any people skills. The elevators are a joke. So so so ridiculously slow pretty much all morning. We pressed the button waited for probably 5 minutes, went back to our room finished packing. Came back out with our luggage and it still hasn't turned up. Finally turned up to be greeted by a half full elevator with a resident basically telling us to forget it and wait for the next one. Love the residents...We used the stairs and beat the elevator down to the ground floor. That felt really good just quietly...To be fair they have an announcement on the wall about upgrading the elevators due to be finished in wait for it two years time.Furthermore if you're disabled in a rush or on the 38th floor? Too bad you guys all just deal with it not their problem whether your a paying customer or not. How lovely.Check out my photo of the notice.Do yourself a favour and please do not stay here. Don't hope it will be okay don't worry about paying more just don't come here please. I can't stress how awful this place is. Unfortunately this hotel was booked by other members of my holiday group so I had no choice. I walked in knowing the reviews and expecting pretty bad but it was even worse than I expected. This honestly shouldn't be a hotel.

The WORST experience I've ever had, my Wife and I stayed here and will be the last time ever. After the 3rd night, we had leak from our bathroom ceiling that came through the light fixtures, it came down so bad it flooded the bedroom and got all of our clothing wet - laundry mind you. We called and it directed us to a voicemail, it wasn't until about 15 minutes later when we received a callback. Maintenance came up right away and by then it was too late, the smell was unbearable and we were moved to another room. When we got to the other room, it appeared that someone was sleeping on the bed already - bed was messy and the bathroom had used towels on the floor with toilet paper all over the place. We made contact with someone again and we were moved to another room, what a mess this whole ordeal was and NO ONE is on site to help us. Our wet clothes remained in our original room and when I asked about these wet clothes, she said 'I will let the Hotel Manager know!'. That was it, no mention of reimbursement or even an offer to wash our clothes to get the filthy smell from them before our return trip home. Nothing about this trip was pleasant other than the Valet, NEVER EVER again - avoid this place at all costs.

I recently stayed here and I was charged twice on my credit card for my stay. Initially the reception said my credit card declined but after I had left the hotel the second duplicate transaction appeared in my account two weeks later. I called and emailed the hotel to get a refund and they have not given my money back and are avoiding the issue. There was only one lift in operation to service 40 floors and we would need to wait at least five minutes for the lift each time we were to use it. When we arrived it was before check in time and there is no reception and we found other visitors waiting outside for hours until check in and it was impossible to contact anyone. Keys are left in keyboxes to attend to on our own accord. The reception did not even know the wifi password and we discovered it ourselves by looking at the label on the router. Our room was nothing like the photos and the worst hotel we had booked throughout our whole trip. The only positive thing is that the valet drivers were extremely nice and helpful but besides that there is nothing good about this hotel.

Wasn't expecting much, but this was the worst place ever! I had booked and paid for 14 nights, left after one. Paid for a deluxe ocean view and got a view of buildings. tower wouldn't stop dripping. Bed was two small beds pushed together that moved. No staff on site at any point, The Key i had stopped working took over an hour to get in contact with anyone. Had to call 5 different numbers, the first person i spoke to said "Im not on site so really can't help you" Finally got a new key and asked for a refund. Has been 8 days have had one response to an email and no money in my account. Only stay here if you want a terrible damper put on your trip to waikiki.

We stayed 12 nights at the Marina Tower and were pleasantly surprised.. yes it's an older building and it's not a serviced hotel but it was perfect for our visit, clean and comfortable room with basic cooking facilties, close to shopping, the beach, restaurants, bus stop across the road. The staff we did see were cheerful, friendly and helpful. If your looking for a budget friendly place without all the bells and whistles this is the place for you!

Stayed here two nights. Facilities in the room were at best basic. Signage to entrance terrible. Valet hours unsuitable to our travel. In the lift is a warning notice that due to service repairs the lift can take up to 40 minutes, and it can delay that long. Reception staff were unfriendly, we didn't look for further support based on poor check-in experience (luckily the security lady helped us so we could find out way to our room). The bedding was uncomfortable and unsuitable. To top it off - I've been left with a $150 charge for a lost FOB which we went to a great deal of effort to return in person at 6am checking out directly at the desk to ensure they received it. After being told a refund would be processed, not being told there is new ownership. I see no improvement of management with this support with issues. Stayed at the Ramada Plaza at the start of the trip, value for money, location, service, staff and the entire experience were far better there. Avoid this place if you can.

Pathetic decor, useless elevator and manager attempting to change my review Mariah Daily this one is for you. I know the build of the hotel inside and out, there aren't many outside elevators. I know where I stayed because I had to return to it every night. Do not attempt to mislead people Mariah. There is a reason for the low reviews, you never responded to my inquiries and attempt to badger me on here saying I stayed elsewhere? I have embarrassing photos I won't even post online. The way the window is, there is a ledge, and you can put your suitcase under that area. Only one hotel in Honolulu that is horrible and it's the one you do not manage or maintain very well.

We stayed hear for 3 nights. I was quite nervous about staying hear as there are many bad reviews, but I don't think it's as bad as everyone makes out. Yes the building is an older one and yes there is one elevator working. However we have a pretty good view from our room and it's in a good location, there is a convenance stall 2 min walk away, beach is 5 min walk away and heaps of restaurants and takeaways all near by. The longest we have waited for the elevator was about 3 minutes and I'm pretty sure the resort is fully booked atm. Check in was also simpler then I thought, there is no front desk but a worker saw us come up to building and assisted us with check in, she was extremely friendly. The only thing I didn't love about this place was the cleanliness. It felt a little dirty there was nothing left dirty as such I'm probably just being a little picky with this. But all and all it was like a quarter of the price of some of the other places in this area so can't complain to much

Stayed here for four nights in Jan 2017 as a lower-cost alternative to the overpriced Hilton where our conference was being held. The efficiency room with a large, comfortable bed included a tiny table, adequate kitchen and bathroom with washing machine. Our 39th floor view was magnificent but the single working, slow, small glass-walled elevator was inconvenient; however, we were thrilled by seeing a rainbow one day! No lobby staff as others have mentioned--check-in was handled by staff at the Equus. Pool was unheated and in a shady area so that was disappointing. Tennis courts which we didn't use. Having to share a single building entry fob and key pass was a nuisance. A reasonable walking distance from the marina, other hotels, bus tour pickup locations and shops/restaurants. If you are a cost-conscious traveler, I would consider this lodging, but other considerations might lead you elsewhere.

This is the worst place. We had 2 rooms and both had cockroaches and the rooms are filthy and noisy. Don't ruin your trip. The photo you'll see on the internet doesn't represent the units. The rooms are dated, unclean and down right filthy. You couldn't pay me to stay there. We renamed the place the tower of terror.

This hotel was horrible forty stories high with only one lift working sometimes you waited half an hour for the lift which apparently has been broken for quiet a while. Our room on floor eleven, has not been updated since the hotel was built, the beds were discusting the mattress was terribly stain in fact our friends stayed in the room next to us and one of there mattresses had blood stains on their Mattress and sheets.The pillows were stained and you could feel the springs digging in to you when you slept , the shower curtain was covered in mould and when you went to the toilet you had to fit under the wash basin overall would not recommend to anyone.

Horrible interior decoration old from 70s and dirty. Ocean front was more like 250sq ft not 500.elevator is very loud. Price I think is high for the room but it is close to Waikiki and good stores and restaurants so I give a star for that. Honestly if you don't care about looks you can survive here if you want looks than avoid this location

Trying to find the place was difficult as it is behind another hotel called the EQUUS and is set back off the road, plus there is no check in desk in this hotel and the check in desk is in the Equus. Eventually we found where to check in and were given a room on the 35th floor the veiw was fabulous however the down side was the fact that there were only two lifts of which one was not working and had not been for two years hence the fact that when you came out of your room you had to wait for the lift the longest we were waiting was 25 mins This is NOT ACCEPTABLE and I would strongly advise that any future travellers check to find out if the lifts are both working before you book,Room was small but clean and comfortable

Very disappointing that we actually found alternate accommodation. 39 floors high and only 1 lift working so extensively long waits up and down. Aircon very noisy at night, lift noise filters thru to rooms at night. Staff friendliness was very average.

Stayed here for 10 nights from 8th Nov & checked out on 18th Nov. There are some ongoing issues with one of the lifts being refurbished so a few times we had to wait for a lift for a few extra minutes but there were plenty of signs up advising about this so really no dramas. The rooms are exactly as advertised - standard and functional and there aren't a lot of bells and whistles and the free wifi was intermittent at best. What wasn't as advertised was the friendliness of the staff and the service......The Marina Tower is generally unattended due to nature of the complex, different unit owners etc. However our experience with the Senior Guest Service Agent - Puka Palenapa and especially the other staff Rene and Jackie was nothing short of exceptional. Their genuine friendliness and helpfulness made our whole holiday for us. From tips about where to get good coffee (the coffee beanery at the Discovery Centre up the road) to where to go dancing (Rumours @ Ala Moana Hotel) and helping us work out the local buses they are fantastic. When I'm on vacation / holidays the room is really just where I lay my head after action packed days sightseeing, shopping, eating and drinking. What sets the Marina Tower apart is their people .......by the end of the week we felt like family ....The whole trip and these lovely people have had such an impact that my husband and I have just changed our plans for our 25th anniversary next year / instead of Europe we are going back to Waikiki and the Marina Tower for October. To Puka, Renee and Jackie Aloha nui loa OhanaAll my love ❤️ family

Room with private bath in good location at decent price. Not a hotel, but apt. rental?? No in person reception. Room not as advertised in photos, a bit disappointed. Air conditioning unit just barely cooled the room.

review_body: When I came in my hotel was supposedly twin bed in a small room but the receptionist decided to give me a room with a queen size bed small kitchen and a city wide view. The room was clean and organized I didn't have any problems with noise and the location is perfect the walk to the mall with Beach art anywhere in Waikiki. On my next visit I plan on staying at the Marina Towers again!

A total dumb, advertised photos don't match the reality, the room is old and furniture old and dusty. Out of 2 lifts, One lift is perm broken and the other is slow and wait could be up to 30-40 min. Management sucks and only want to deal via text. There is no daily cleaning of the rooms or change of towels. It sucks.

We found our room on the 26th floor to be reasonably comfortable with a hugh bed and a good although partial sea view . The kitchen though could do with a revamp and a full compliment of equipment. There is a nice pool area behind the hotel and the security staff were friendly. But be aware that this hotel has 39 floors and only two lifts of which one will be out of action until 2018.

Outstanding veiw from our Room 3902.....thats where it ended. The Room is so run down...needs so much work done to it. Then there is the cockroaches at night in the kitchenette. The staff are friendly and helpful.

I really don't know how Room 3901 is allowed to to be booked. It was disgusting... Chairs with foam hanging out, cupboards broken, broken tiles in the shower and the list goes on. No care at all and pics advertised on bookings.com were not even close to this room. 1 of 2 elevators working for a 40 storey building. We walked straight out and demanded a full refund.

Room is so bad i wouldnt let my dog stay in it. It smells of mould and is very dirty. Oh and only 1 lift that fits 4 people to servis 40 floors.we payed for a ocean view room and the only ocean we can see is between 2 buildings this place is a rip off and we will not be coming back

This room exceeded my expectations and at such a great rate. The view was breathtaking and accommodations were wonderful. I would move in to this room and live here if I could! Will be booking for my future and near reservations.

My wife and I have traveled the world on multiple occasions staying in accommodation from 5 star to little above backpackers but this place takes the cake. We had booked to stay 19 nights but finally had enough by the 8th night. The unit was dirty, stained bedside lamps, torn and stained chair, bathroom basin blocked and a plunger was provided under the sink to help encourage the drainage. the A/C rattled so loud it drowned out the TV and when the lift started up it drowned out the A/C.The 2 bedside lights didn't work so as a retired professional electrical engineer I repaired them myself. The window catch was broken & wouldn't shut properly or lock - I repaired that myself. All the above issues singularly are excusable and able to be lived with as this is only a 2 star condo, but when there is such a multitude of these minor issues it.s not acceptable. The final nail in the coffin was when the second lift began operating and all night it was like two F15's taking off in the bedroom as the lift went up the 40 stories and then back down again, even earplugs failed to have any effect. We spoke to a local professional Realty Appraiser who advised us that the building has had a court order placed on it for over 10 years to replace the lifts and to date has done nothing but put up a notice. The Australian agency we booked through have been notified and advised to remove it from their listings.

review_body: Friendly staff and residents, room 2304 had a nice partial ocean view. Rooms are old but for the cost compared to modern, nicer ones it's a no brainer. A hop skip and jump to Ala Moana, Waikiki Beach, Marina, Lagoon and bus stops at your door step basically! ABC store 2 doors down as well as places to eat. Pic from elevator 23rd floor of hotel pool area and across from the canal is Ala Moana Shopping centre! Elevators play up at times so be prepared to wait a lil while or take the stairs. Was no big hassle for us. For the cost and location I would stay here again.

As Maui residents people ask us, "Where do you stay when you're in Honolulu?" The answer is Marina Tower. That's odd you might think. It's back from the ocean, sits down a lane, and has no real amenities . There are reasons and here they are.First, we aren't interested in a destination resort. As restaurant critics we're in the city to work. Since it's business price is a big criteria. At $109 to $119 a night for a panoramic ocean view room you can't do much better in Honolulu.Then, what about the panoramic view ocean view room? They're on top of the building and look out over the Pacific. During day time you can see Pearl Harbor and Diamond Head. At night the lights are absolutely magical.This is a condo hotel. The lower floor rooms aren't anything to write home about. But on top the owners know what they have and use it themselves. The difference shows. Expect a nice kitchenette, small bath, large bed, and wall-to-wall windows.

I stayed at this hotel over two stays in August and found that the staff from front desk to security were so lovely. We had an issue with their website upon booking but they were so good to us that they sorted out a special rate as we brought an error to their attention then gave us a voucher for a hotel too which was unexpected. At all times they were professional and helpful by enabling us to check in early. We stayed on level 38-39-4o and the rooms were clean with amazing views! The pool area is clean and the lifts even though are under construction were not causing long delays if any at all. We had a major 3 day delay with Jetstar screwing up our flights but the hotel gave us a refund which they didn't have to but they did and we found this to be extremely good hospitality. It was jetstars fault yet this hotel saw the disadvantage that this would have caused hundreds of other travellers to Hawaii and so took it upon themselves to jump in and help us. Truly awesome customer service experience. Nothing but good things to say about our stay here and I will be coming back here soon as my hotel of choice. This is how you do customer service! Well done to all staff. Be proud as you made our trip special due to just listening to us, effective communication and being helpful. Thank you for a very good visit.

This is an older building ?1970's ( therefore reasonable size room but showing its age, wear and tear) with Lifts being upgraded presently (sign says expect delays to 2019!!).air conditioning was noisy but cooled well for a good nights sleep.The staff at the adjoining Equus boutique hotel provide check in. Puka was superb assistance as our first 2 days were cancelled due to Jetstar engineering fault delay in Brisbane. When we returned after a 3 day visit to Kaua'i, Rene was again very helpful 10/10 for customer service. Great ocean views from 01 / 02 numbered rooms we had up high level. Pool, washing facilities, security, walk to Ala Moana shopping complex.

Upon arriving after a 9 hour flight , we were left stranded for 3.5 hrs as Jeannie had ignored our calls to get entry into the building . Once contact was made we fought hard to get the nights accomodation reimbursed we had to shell out for . Once we were in the apartment everything was just fine a little cramped in the bathroom and noisy aircon unit but for the price it did the job . Ensure you have a door code you can enter the room with incase your stuck with the excuse of the cleaners in the apartment and make contact before you fly out .

There is no concierge at the apartments you need to go to the hotel next door which was fine for us as our taxi driver told us but others couldn't work where to go. One of the rooms we had was lovely the other was terrible, it smelt of mould, the Toilet didn't flush properly, the Airconditioning was so loud & you Couldn't turn it off. The lifts were dodgey and luckily our rooms weren't really close to them as I gather the people in the rooms near by couldn't handle the noise. Boy rooms had amazing views and very Clive to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and the Ala Moana beach. Only a few minutes walk to the Hard Rock Cafe and shops

The room even though clean and tidy the decor leaves you wondering why we booked it. The price was right!Good shower/ bathroom. Kitchen outdated . TV all good. Positives, even though away from the middle of Waikiki of about 25 minute stroll their is half a dozen restaurants, a pub that's open till 2am. Car hire places within 4 min walk and Ala Moana shopping centre 10 min walk.Worth staying just not luxurious.

The hotel charged my credit card the full booking 56 days out, and now that we cancelled, which was supposed to be free of charge before 30 days out. We are stuck with bank charges and fx rates difference! Sad that a hotel has heard of credit card authorisation rather than charging the full amount! Never going to an establishment that charges you the full booking over a month ahead of time, leaves a bad taste that your priority is not the guests!

A couple of blocks away from downtown Waikiki in one direction and the Ala Moana Mall in the other direction the location for us was perfect. The lagoon is just across the road and a quieter but just as nice a beach as Waikiki is also just a short walk.When we arrived in our room the view was just breathtaking. We booked a full ocean view for barely more than a partial and were very pleased we did. We could see from the Lagoon all the way along the coast to the airport. Beautiful.But don't be expecting luxury. This is 2* accommodation.First a note to all staying - there is no reception specifically for this accommodation!I walked around the block on our arrival trying to find where to check-in. You check in with the Equus Hotel next door and any queries are dealt with there.Our room was next to the elevators and was noisy because of that.The elevators were working when we stayed although slow, but they put a note on them the day we were leaving to say repairs were to be carried out until 2019! We were on the 32nd floor and if this had been the case when we were there it would have been a nightmare. I had requested a lower level room on booking but had not been given this request.The room itself was comfortable and spacious for the price. It had a fridge, microwave, stovetop etc, although a bit of a small space to cook a meal. The decor is aging in the kitchen/bathrooms and the cleanliness could have been better. There is no restaurant in the hotel although there is a local delivery service. There is free wifi throughout and there are laundry facilities. The hotel has a private pool and tennis courts which are lovely and also very quiet when we were there. The rooms are not serviced during your stay, but a change of sheets and plenty of towels are provided. I would say if the view is what you're after and you're a single or couple on a budget, give it a go. But if you would have any concerns about being able to walk up flights of stairs if necessary -this one might not be for you.

The room could not be faulted. I had to wait an average time of 15 mins for the only elevator to arrive to the 38th floor. One day, after a trip around the island, that (external) remaining elevator was turned off due to high winds., It was 4 pm; I had been out all day and was being collected for an interisland flight at 5 am. Wasn't impressed. I had not seen a concierge the whole visit and only saw the security person qwhen waiting the 4 hours for the elevator to be turned on again. She suggested I see Mariah Dailey at The Equus next door, and I moved in there, free of charge. I was able to go up and collect my gear at 8pm.This hotel is NOT recommended for this reason. The locals said it happens from time to time and they were worried about the elevator cable. Basically, so was I!!!!

I specifically requested and booked a partial ocean view room to be given one with one inch of sea view..I complained bitterly and was given another room on the 11th floor with a better outlook straight down. I settled in and liked the room..great service...they really helped with every request..check free WiFi, fix alarm for 4am rising, free coffee at Aquas while waiting for room with banana muffins and apples and beautiful brewed coffee..I love the ABC store next door, the beach across the road and the bus stops and walking to Ala Moana..I was very happy once I settled in...

Don't do it. The only good thing is the price. Average $115 for 6 nights. Room smelled. Wall A/C loud. Six days no maid service. Hard bed. No view. Elevators are loud and slow. Shower sucks. Seriously, I'd be embarrassed to bring a woman here. I am normally pretty flexible but this place sucks. Batteries in the remote died. No one here to complain to. You check in at another hotel. They don't care.
