review_body: I'm staying at Waikiki Marina at 1700 Ala Moana Blvd. Unit 3704. Awesome view! Right across from Ilikai Hotel. You can see Fireworks on Friday with great view right in front! Ocean front with 4 huge panels glass window. Spectacular for $99/night special deal. Their regular price is $145/night and that's still a great deal! With Free Parking plus hotel tax and $75 cleaning fee. The only problems is the elevator is slow! They will renovate them by next year they said. And the refrigerator making noise on and off so I had to sleep with the pillows covering my ears. But I still would rate it 4.5 stars since it's a really good deal.

when we booked in(reception in car park) the room had not been cleaned. We were UPGRADED the room was in very poor condition, the shower was one that you could not wait to get out of without touching walls,the lift broke down twice in the four days we were there.

If you are looking for a place to just rest and shower then this place is for you. The room was dated. The carpet was dirty - stained. The bed was comfortable. Shower worked good. A/C was noisy but kept the place cool. Only one elevator was working but we were told this prior to booking. We did not use any of the cooking facilities. No bugs were seen on bed or in room so that is a plus. White towels were stained. Friends had booked one on the 36th floor. They had dirty sheets when they arrived. We booked ours through Alli Beach Rentals. They came and changed sheets that afternoon. Did not use pool. Saw security maybe twice at the front desk. Good location walking distance to downtown. Anyway we did not spend any time in room other than to sleep and shower. Price was reasonable for Hawaii.

I stayed at the marina tower for 4 nights with my partner. I personally didn't experience any problems with the elevators. I enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi that were clean. I am not a fussy person so I saw no issues with my room. There was a bed, toilet, shower, a tv with cable and I was happy with that. The staff at the Equus Hotel (where you check in and out) allowed my partner use their phone a few times which was nice. I would recommend this hotel as it has all the essentials. It was about maybe a 15 walk to the main shopping district

For starters, I am not a fussy person. Could this condo have used some TLC? Yes. Did I sleep well, eat well, not catch any diseases and was close to all things Honolulu.... yes. Was it clean? So-so. The shower didn't drain well and was dirty in the corners. Did the elevators work? Only one (due to high winds, the sign said...there are two elevators) and it did take a while to catch it- avg 2-5 min), but like the locals say "Aren't you on vacation? Then you are on Hawaii time!" . Was the furniture dated? yes, but it was comfy. Go to any average home on the island and see what they have for furniture...you will no longer complain. The kitchen was small but useful and functioned. Full size fridge with freezer. Washer and dryer on both the 3rd and 4th floors, worked fine (coin operated). The pool was clean and refreshing, as was the jacuzzi. There is a wonderful brand new barbeque located near the pool. Be sure to grill up some food there. The window in our room opened to the marina view, on the 36th floor. We slept with it closed at night and the AC on, which is a bit loud but I love a noise to sleep to anyway, Main point- it worked and our place was very cool. During the day we left it open and it was a beautiful breeze. No trace of any insects in our room. there is also a security guard posted outside, I noticed them every evening (as we were gone all day I cannot say if they were there then) and watched them do regular rounds (I can see their desk from the pool/jacuzzi).In summary, this place could use an update, mostly the bathroom, but if you are a fussy yuppie, feel free to go down the street to the Hilton and get what you want, and what you'll surely pay for. This place was a good enough deal for being in the heart of Waikiki. one more note- this building is shaped like a triangle. On the side facing inland, towards the city and mountains, is the elevators. on the other two sides are two condos per side, so four rooms per floor. Therefore, all rooms higher up have a great view. I was on the 36th floor and loved it.

Here for 5 nights April '16... Elevators extremely slow, apartment had not had bins emptied when we arrived and room was dirty. Sheets had holes. Only positive was fabulous view. No t-towels , had trouble with shower not draining!!

Stayed in Unit 3301. GREAT VIEW BUT THAT IS ALL. Very small Unit. The elevators were constantly out of order and extremely noisy. One elevator was permanently "out of order". (From previous reviews, this problem has been ongoing for many months!) One day the 2nd elevator was not working and we were trapped for the entire day on the 33rd floor as we were not willing to walk back up - 33 floors. On another day we walked down the 33 floors. THANKFULLY when we got back, the ONE elevator was working.This Unit does not sleep 3 as advertised. Only 1 King bed. Cooker, kettle and pots were dirty on arrival. Some cutlery had rust marks. Manager not available the 4 times we went looking for assistance.

Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa

review_body: Don't ever think of going in this hotel.We had to wait for 15 mins every single time to go up or down the floors because the lifts are so bad they don't even work.Broken windows in rooms.Nt a very good view as well.No parking. They charge too much for this.The only reason we stayed there for two days is the gentleman on the reception.He's the only one good about this hotel.

As I arrived, the guy on the desk told me that one of the lifts was broken and they'd slowed the other one down because of the wind. I wasn't really aware of any heavy winds, but I wasn't that fussed - I'm on holiday, I wasn't in a hurry. Alas, I didn't realise this was the slowest lift in the world. You could easily wait ten minutes for it to arrive at your floor. As it approached the floor it was stopping on, it was like the docking of the space shuttle. I really don't know why it had to approach its destination at a snail's pace.On day 2, this lift also broke. It was out of order all day. This meant hiking up and down to and from the 22nd floor. Pity those on the 36th floor!In my three day stay, the room was only serviced once. This was possibly as a consequence of the broken lift, I'm not sure.Largely, the room was great. A good size. A good view. Well-equipped. The toilet had a shelf over the cistern meaning that it was impossible to sit up straight when sitting on the toilet.All in all, it's a hotel with so much promise, it just fails to deliver.

This tower is 10 min walk to the Waikiki beach and the most famous shopping center. Actually it is a walking distance to almost all attractive activities and places. The room we stayed is good for 3 people, mid-range, no luxury, but with a good view of the sea and fireworks on weekends. The cons: around 25$ daily car parking fee.

When I checked in on the 34th floor I was delighted with the view. Soon all delight disappeared after trying to use the lift. Each journey down and up took around 20-30 minutes. After the first day the lift was out for up to 4 hours at a time. In addition my room was not serviced until I rang up at around 7pm. The toilet was a nightmare, suitable only for a 2 year old doing potty training due to the overhang of the counter. I complained bitterly and was moved to a different hotel.

We were given an upgrade on our room on arrival which was a nice touch as it was our honeymoon, however, being on the 39th floor was an inconvenience when there were only 2 lifts and 1 of which was out of order for at least a month. On our 1st night the working lift broke down and we had to wait for 4 hours until it was fixed so that we could return to our room (which threw our entire night out of whack). When ever we needed anything from reception (i.e. to borrow an AUS power plug adaptor or cork screw) we were always given the same response of "we don't have any spare for you, sorry".

I’ve rented a unit on the 33rd floor twice now through Ali’i Beach Rentals. The unit offers a great view, is more spacious than a regular hotel room, well equipped, very clean and a parking spot included at a good price. It’s located closer to the Ala Moana mall than the main part of Waikiki and the beach is really close. Possible negatives would be no lanai (balcony) and the elevators are iffy like most 40-50 year old buildings (supposedly a full rebuild is in the works).ABR has a good booking process, you can check availability and total price right away so I can coordinate booking my flights. They ask for a check 30 days prior to arrival but they'll charge CC if they don't receive it in time which I would prefer anyways No contract to sign and fax/pdf back and no security deposit. I've not used their app (Blackberry not supported) but their 3-4 page pdf is all there is anyways. The info is good and could evolve maybe with more pictures and more simple details covered. Their staff have been friendly to deal with and available for my inquiries on reservations, accounting, maintenance related.

Actually, the other reviewers pretty much described the place. We were on the 27th floor with a nice westward view. The room was small, basically a small studio, but everything worked. The wall opposite the windows was mirrored, which gave the illusion of the room being much bigger. Comfy king size bed. The location is good for access to Ala Moana Shopping Center and Beach Park. Fireworks across the street on Friday. There is a Japanese department store in the shopping center with a food court on the second floor. Unusual food and a terrific deal. The shopping center also has its own food court. Two negatives: being on Ala Moana Blvd, it's loud, even 27 floors up. If you like to sleep with the windows open, expect street noise. Second, there are only two elevators and one was broken the entire week. Imagine 39 floors of residents, plus housekeeping and maintenance folks using a single elevator - a VERY slow elevator - and you can see the problem. Owners we met said it was a common problem. Anyway, don't expect to get in or out in a hurry, or take the stairs (both elevators were dead one morning and we walked down 27 floors).Enjoy Manhattan in paradise!

Friendly staff, clean rooms, beautiful views of Waikiki Beach and the marina. Close to shopping and restaurants. As a solo traveler, they were very gracious and helpful, providing me with directions and suggestions for places to visit. I would highly recommend!

Rented a room on the 30th floor for 2 weeks. Beautiful and relaxing view looking directly at the Ala Wai Boat Harbor and the Ala Moana Park. It is within walking distance to the huge Ala Moana Mall (of course it has a huge food court). The Walmart is a little further away behind from the mall. The bus stops are right around the corner. There are restaurants all over the place (even a couple of Pho Vietnamese noodle places not too far away). We did not rent a car this time so we did not use the reserved parking spot that came with the unit. The weather and the view are so perfect that my wife and I took a walk twice a day, and I usually don't walk much.The owner's direction for entering may appear confusing but really rather simple. Don't get frustrated over reading it. The room is a little small but OK for a short vacation. It is furnished with all necessities. We brought 2 small bags of ground coffee and glad we did. The TV controls are not too user friendly though. Pushes the wrong button and you may end up having to call the owner (he is friendly enough). The shower works fine. The shower spray head was designed by a mad engineer I am sure.The elevators were something else. It seemed that the two elevators take turns on breaking down everyday. Allow plenty of time for waiting. While waiting one day, the owner of another unit was there and he said the building is planning to replace the elevators later this year. They need to.There seems to be ABC store all over the place. The first night when we arrived we bought some bread and bananas from the ABC around the corner. The small loaf of bread cost $6.99. The banana cost $0.79 EACH. Go somewhere else. Yes, the place was jammed with tourists so prices of everything should be expected to be high. We went for dinner at the Outrigger Waikiki one night, the parking at the hotel was $12 for about an hour.We took a taxi from the airport. The meter showed about $35. I gave the driver $40.Wished we could stay longer---- The next time we might look for a place with a view towards Waikiki Beach because we could not see the new years eve firework from our unit.

We stayed here 8 nights. The hotel not really worth the money we spent to be honest. We booked a deluxe room with ocean view. The room was ok, even if I expected more from a deluxe room, the bed was too little.Wifi was ok. Parking was $3 for half an hour, I didn't even ask for the whole night. In fact, we parked at the harbor.If you wanted to use the safe it was $3 each day. I don't recommend this hotel. I think there are lot better hotels for less price.

We checked in and the staff was very friendly, however we had paid for a deluxe ocean view and was given a room with no ocean view. I went back down and requested to change rooms to the room we had paid for but was moved to an Ocean view room that was very old and dirty. We were told all of the rooms were booked and they could not move us until the next day. The rooms are owned privately and decorated by each owner so there is no standard level of quality. We were moved the flowing day to a much nicer room with an Ocean view but it was a hassle to move again. The rooms are small and crowded. and the view is better the higher the floor is. The hotel parking is terrible, if you use the valet you have to wait long times each time you want to get your car and the garage is so full there isn't room to get cars in and out each time the valet goes for your car they must move around several cars in order to make room. We paid for the service but later decided to street park and that can be a long walk as parking fills fast. The ocean views are great and location is wonderful close to beach and shops.

Yes, this building had its problems with the elevator and with the water one day while I was there but I have never found a better room for the money. The staff were top notch. After an issue with the water (that was no personal inconvenience to me) they gave me a $25 gift certificate for the Chart House Restaurant across the street. After a manager found I didn't have a key fob for entrance to the building (this is a mixed use building with rentals and people who live there and there are a limited amount of fobs but it was no big deal, someone from the staff always let me in when I showed my room key) she wrote me a personal apology note and left it with a fresh pineapple and another $25 gift certificate to the Chart House in my room.The building is older and has its issues, but for the price you will not find a better view and a more caring staff. Mahalo to Lela, Ramon, Kaori, Rene, Archie, Erik, and Mariah for going above and beyond and making me feel like ohana the week I was there. I will definitely be back!

39 floors and only one lift working (apparently for the last year). Waited for 15 minutes to get a lift!! Stairwell not suitable for use except in emergency. Rooms ok but a little tired and need redecorating. Air con very noisy. Parking is $25 per night so a hidden cost as on site. Location however is good and just across road from marina. 10 mins walk to main shops.

Close to everything downtown. Lots to do just a walk away. That's the good. We had to clean our room when we checked in. Had to request a mattress pad even after we turned it over. Only one of two elevators worked all week! Last night the one was out. We were told it would take 1 1/2 hours to fix. Walked up 33 floors in dress clothes with a wife in heels. A little much to askFor the price.

Arrived late and left early due to an eight hour layover between flights. Our 11th floor king size bed was comfortable but that was about the only redeeming feature of the room. The 'serviced apartment's' decor was old and tired and smelled of smoke. The road noise coming in through the window mounted air conditioner was noisy and excessive. In hindsight our taxi and accomodation costs could have been better saved by sleeping on seats at the airport! On a positive note, our check in clerk was polite and helpful.

Recently have come home from a holiday to Marina Tower which was an average hotel. For the same money we could have stayed at a better hotel in Waikiki. Please do your research.The staff are brilliant. Didn't matter what we enquired about they were able to assist.The rooms were outdated but it is what you would expect in Hawaii although the bathroom was disgusting and dirty. We had to go to the shops to buy cleaning agents to clean before using the shower. The airconditioner is very noisy and tried to get it fixed but the maintenance man said they are all noisy and nothing they could do. The lifts were aweful just aweful to have 1 lift working for the entire hotel is pathetic. They said it was broken then due to it being windy. But it was not working that entire time we were there.

Booked this Hotel before the cruise we where going to take around the islands. Turned out not to be a hotel, but a serviced apartment Location was good, but a kitchenette without utensils is no much use to anyone. A small tired and worn out bathroom and a odd shaped corner room, but with good partial ocean views. Only one working lift for so many floors make for safety risk, for that reason alone I wouldn't stay there again.

The first night we stayed at the marina tower we hardly slept because the elevator sounded like an aeroplane taking off. We asked to be moved also to a room with a better view, this was no problem, the manager and his wife were extremely helpful. The only drawback at this hotel is the elevator and only one worked so sometimes we walked down 18 floors.

The view is absolutely amazing so take the highest floor possible. Comfort bed. A bit long waiting time for the elevator. Great location, the ocean is about 5 minutes walking. Plenty restaurants around. Red Lobster is just across the street, very qualified food

We enjoyed our stay at the Marina tower. This place is perfect for a smaller budget ! we hoped for friendly staff and we got it!! We stayed for a week and had no problems except for a slow elevator, and still not too much of a inconvenience. We enjoyed the views from our room. I would definitely stay here again

Although there a lot of poor reviews about this hotel, we were pleasantly surprised. We had a room on the 26th floor. Initially one lift was working, but the second lift was repaired and working by the time we left. The room was triangular - there are 4 rooms on each of the 39 floors. Each room on the upper levels will have an ocean view from the panoramic windows. The room was a good size, with a comfy bed and cooking facilities/fridge/coffee maker. There was a table and chairs and plenty storage space. The shower was clean and powerful. Linen and toiletries were provided daily. The safe was free, as was the wi-fi. The staff were friendly and courteous, but the hotel reception is within the Equus hotel just a short distance from the tower. There is a pool and jaccuzi area as well as a tennis court. Valet parking is available. The hotel is on Ala Moana Boulevarsd and is within walking distance of the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. It is very close to the boat harbour and the beach near the Hilton Lagoon. Less than 2 minutes from the hotel is an ABC store and bars and restaurants.

I had my share of problems from leaky ceilings ,noisy neighbors, cigarette and marijuana odors coming thru the bathroom vents. Several times I found coffee cups , cigarette butts on my car roof . ( my assigned parking stall is uncovered) My car that looked nice before I move to this place is now dinged up from the falling objects from people on the upper floors throwing stuff out their window. OH and not to mention the drug chronics that hang around outside the lobby door that try to sneak into the building so they can get their fix from a unit on the 7th floor.

This was a pretty cheap hotel that I enjoyed. The most obvious thing to note is that we did not stay there a whole lots, ITS HAWAII! Our place was fully furnished with a kitchenette. I heeded all the review regarding the elevator but we got by with 1 of 2 elevators working. Valet parking was ridiculous but you could find street parking here and there. I would have loved to been close to the water, but it was definitely a cheap way to go!One thing that was awesome was to have the WIFI Router in the room!

We stayed at the Marina Tower before a cruise. Overall we were very pleased. The view from our room was awesome. The location was an easy walk to the beach. Complimentary happy hour was a plus. Friendly staff. Close to the bus route out to Pearl Harbor.

None of our booking information mentioned that we needed to check in next door at the Equis. The reception at the marina tower was constantly unmanned. Lucky there was a guy wandering around and we asked him! On check in we were given no information regarding use or location of the pool. One lift was out for maintenance and the first morning, the remaining lift broke down and we had to walk down. Fortunately we were only on level 14! People from above us were coming down dragging lots of luggage. Our room passes were mis coded and we could not get back into our room. Back to reception next door for new swipes. The room was clean and had what it said. The overall property is reasonably run down. There was a constant funky smell in the foyer, like a floral masking smell...The air conditioner in the room was SO noisy, it sounded like a train with no let up at all. There was also another loud noise which was intermittent but constant. I expect it was the lift. (When it worked)I guess the rooms are serviced because we had fresh towels on the second day, but the bed was not made. The towel rail also constantly fell down with the slightest movement of a towel. The price was ok, but the distance too far from the main drag, it is however only 5 mins walk to Ala Moana centre. We would not return here.

Although the kitchenette and Big Bed was great, and it's location was good, it's located across the street from Red Lobster and Out Back Steak House, and in close walking distance to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, keep you expectations low, as to not be too disappointed. The rooms are a bit dated, the tv was a blue screen for the 4 nights we stayed there, and no one came to fix it even if we called the first night, probably because all hands were in deck to fix the elevator. Since we got there, one was always out of order, but on our 2nd day both were down, and the lobby was filled with people staying on the 20th and 30th floors. We chanced the stairs, but it was a very claustriphobic, and dizzy climb to the 10th floor. Woke up the next morning, and it was another climb down to the lobby. Bathroom is very cramped, no soap or shampoo the first night. Air con is loud, no balcony, and no screen covering the large window, so keeping the window open is not an option, not to mention tje awkward wall to wall mirrors. Tried to keep an open mind that you get what you pay for.

I travelled to Hawaii for the Spartan race trifecta weekend. I booked this room a few months back and after reading reviews was very apprehensive about what I was going to find. Upon arrival I was greeted by the friendly valet who offered to hold the bags downstairs so I didn't have to lug them around if we couldn't check in yet. The front desk was courteous and even though I couldn't check in early they were quite helpful. Once checked in the room was certainly no 5 star hotel. But I don't think it's worth the bad reviews people are giving. For the price it had a reasonably comfortable king size bed. Stove top. Air con. A decent size bathroom. It had everything we needed and more. We were pleasantly surprised that this hotel was not what all the people have made it out to be. Sure you can stay in central Waikiki. But your paying twice as much.. And for what .. The trolley leaves right across the road and is $2 for a trip and take approx 10 mins to get to the beach. The shopping centre is a 5 minute walk. The Hilton beach and lagoon are a 5 minute walk. Plenty of restaurants close by. Abc store on the corner. Both myself and my partner would definitely recommend staying at this hotel as its a fraction of the price of central Waikiki and still has a comfort about it ! It probably could do with a repaint and freshen up - but really that's about all :) Really enjoyed our stay - the valet even started work 20 minutes early so we could get our car on time to make it to Spartan race at Kualoa ranch on time ! Will stay here again next year for sure !

Great view from room. Very good location with ABC convenience store nearby plus restaurants like Red Lobster, Outrigger and others. Short walk to both Ala Moana Beach Park and Waikiki beach. Ask for a room on a high floor with sea view facing Ala Moana beach. Ala Moana shopping centre is a 5 minute walk. No bath tub.

Unfortunately I booked this hotel in a rush and didnt do my usual TripAdvisor research just saw an offer on another site. I am sorry to be scathing but this place was a nightmare from the moment we arrived findibg you check in with the hotel at front to the uninviting foyer, to the rattly lifts (one which continually broke down, to the shabby room and dirty bathroom. We were on the 35th floor the views were stunning but honestly that was it! !!. The pool was dowdy and depressing nothing like the photos on line. This "resort" needs an esthetic overhaul and some well needed maintenance particularly on the lifts. After 24 hours we couldnt stand it anymore and found much superior accommodation. (Thank goodness).

Views of the yacht harbor , ocean and city were panoramic and superb! Comfortable room with kitchen.... Good bed and quiet as well. Elevators a bit slow, but with only 4 rooms on each floor, wait times weren't bad. Staff very helpful and courteous . Best of all for business in Honolulu is the location. On the west/ city side of Waikiki ... So easy to get in and out for meetings downtown. Overall a good buy price wise....

We stayed on the 29th floor, room was amazing , incredible views of Waikiki and we even got to see the fireworks on the Queen Kamehameha public holidays, they also have laundry on the same building , room had a small fridge and kitchen amenities, very spacious looked brand new. However there were some bad reviews from rooms below the 10th floor herefore make sure you pick a good room to avoid unpleasant surprises. Ps. lift was a pain in the ...., under maintenance during a whole day but second lift was working fine besides very slow.Hotel is 10 minutes walking from central area of Waikiki....great location

What a hole, do not get a room on 8th floor. This is a residents building with some rooms sublet. The furniture was a hundred years old, stench about the same age. Air cond unit held together with suck tape. Old mat on the floor looked like a dog had slept on it for years. The fridge was nearer rust coloured than white. We had friends who stayed on the 23rd floor, their room was newer, better equipped and had glorious views of the Marina. The owner was amazed by my criticism, said he had never had a complaint before.I left room without staying overnight and moved next door to Equus, same price 5 star service

Marina Tower is certainly an older style accommodation, however after doing much research, the price was good for a self contained unit, close handy to the beach, Ala Moana Shopping Centre, and being on the 36th floor, our view was lovely. Sadly we couldn't open our window for some fresh air, so had to resort to the A/C. It's not five star, but covered all our needs, keeping in mind quite a lot of apartments in Waikiki are dated and on the older side of things.

Very nice place in a very nice area the staff is very nice and helpful. The staff are pretty fast way you need some help. My only complaint was the photos was not the same as the rooms and my bathroom was a little dirty. But besides that it was a good experience at this hotel and I recommend you to visit.

We stayed on 31st floor which was a bit of a pain as most of the time only 1 lift was working & this lift had trouble coping with this amount of tenants. Great views, great location very close to Ala Moana shopping & short walk to beach. On arrival we had to check in next door at Equus, receptionist there was very helpful & friendly.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the marina tower. Accommodations were nice. Kitchen was awesome. The people at the desk and the valets were amazing. The view....omg. spectacular. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip. Very happy. Sad to leave.

After along flight I was in shock at my accommodations. It was late and I learn that there is no actual lobby and had to walk over to the next hotel to check in. Must be the same management company. There was only 1 out of 2 elevators working the whole time I was there. When you walk into the hotel it felt like walking back in time to the 70's. It looks, smells and feels old! It was a ghetto hotel and good thing it was a good deal. My room was dirty with a strong mildew smell in the bathroom. The iron had black dirty coming out constantly. Just nasty! The only clean part of the room was the bed sheets. The only positive thing part of the room was the view. If all you want is the cheapest price and only looking to sleep in your room then it's ok.The staff was friendly and did their best.Hawaii in general has out dated hotel rooms.

I stayed at Marina Tower Waikiki for 6 nights. The Hotel is quite nice and is quiet, but not at all well known for shuttle services. Getting picked up to go to Airport or other things - did not go well as they could not find the Hotel. It does not have restaurant but the rooms do have a kitchenette. It is well located for shopping, beach,Ala Moana Mall and there are eateries close by. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for some where to stay in Waikiki, but beware if reliant on shuttles to come and go.
user_name:
Beverley H H
Rotorua, New Zealand

review_body: the lanlord, Jason, was great to deal with and the view was awesome. the place could definitely been cleaner.the free parking is a bonus as is the free WIFIthe biggest issue is the elevators not working and the number of fire alarms. this is a constant problem here as we met many owners on the street in the wee hours of the night.from 27 floors down and the carrying of groceries up; the stairs are quite overwhelmingthe ABC on the corner is better than the tourist locations and has some groceries available.the beach is close through the marina or over the canal in the park.the Mall is close and easy access.it is a hike to the main Waikiki beach but is do-able for the abled.always feel safe walking even at night

I agree with the well-organized points noted by DSTravelbugs. The unit is clean & decorated very nicely. The bath towels are large & fluffy & the shower works great. The building location is very convenient & it was great to have parking included. An ABC grocery store is located very close by. The view through the immense windows was gorgeous & perhaps made up for any minor issues (noted below) we experienced during our stay.We used the smaller of the two refrigerators so we could turn down the temp on the larger one as it was a bit noisy. Also noisy (to my husband) was the window air conditioning unit, although it masked traffic noise & did help me sleep. The elevator noise was bothersome to me but not my husband, perhaps because he slept on the side of the bed away from the door. An elevator was closed for one day during our stay because of high winds & the other one felt a little shaky & required a long wait. Nice view of the city, though, from the glass elevator.I would recommend that the management buy sheets that fit the bed. Ours kept coming off over & over again no matter how tightly we tucked them in & would bunch up underneath us during the night. We did not use the laundry facilities, tennis court or pool, so cannot comment on them. We saw others using the court & they seemed to be having a good time.Overall we had a lovely stay here. It was a good base for travel around the island, Waikiki & Honolulu in general. Checking in/out was easy & instructions provided by the owner/manager were clear.

The place is well equipped, the staff is very nice, and it's a good location. It's off the main strip a little bit and it's more quiet than the hotels closer to downtown Waikiki. The upper floors get a great breeze and offer a great view! I opened the windows several days and the fresh air was great!. It quiet and secure enough to leave the windows opened at night.The elevators were in and out of commission while I was there. One elevator can take up to 25 min to get to you, depending on the time of day so plan ahead. Maybe they'll have them both up when you come.....lol (PS the building sways in high wind...it's kind of cool)It's walking distance to the beach. It's alos close to both the Waikiki strip (party strip and high dollar stores) and the Ala Moana mall so shopping in the low and high spending ranges are both easily accessibleI didn't use the laundry facilities but they are available. I did make good use of the kitchenette and was able to stock the fridge and make dinner for my friends.

We stayed at the Waikiki Marina condo #3804 for almost two weeks. It was functional - and for that good price, we would consider staying here again.The good:- Price- Location of building in walking distance to Ala Moana Mall, several beaches and lagoon, and buses and car rental agency. We also walked to Waikiki.- Expansive window overlooking the ocean and Marina and with a view of the Friday night fireworks- Garage parking included- Laundry room in building- Bath, face, hand, and beach towels supplied- Fully furnished kitchenThe not so good:- Can hear the elevators running from inside the condo (sounds like an airplane)- Glass elevators will stop randomly without the doors opening when the elevators shake too much- Not enough closet or drawer space for clothes- Dusty corners and nights stands (including dusty collection of phone books)- Dated decorFor a small room, we didn't feel cramped. The window and mirrors helped. However we don't recommend anymore than two people for this room.

The room with a kitchenette was nice with a great view through the other buildings to the ocean. We were up above the 25th floor and the windows are huge. The elevators are glass fronted outside so you might want to face the door if heights are a problem. I requested an upper floor so the elevators were fine. Check in is with the Equis hotel next door, but a departing guest gave us that information after we stood around trying to figure out how to get in the locked door. Also next door was the Thursday evening tasty Mai Tai happy hour. Convenient to bus stop, Waikiki Beach, and walking distance to cheap eats at Snappers Bar and the hike up to Diamond Head. Wired internet was fast. Just remember to pack a cord!

My husband and I stayed at the Marina Tower Waikiki for four nights. It was a last-minute non-refundable arrangement that had been made without consulting me. Needless to say, after reading the recent TripAdvisor reviews and ratings, I was dreading my stay there. Realizing that a better hotel would cost at least $100/night more (not to mention the non-refundable situation), we decided to stick it out. What a relief to find that our room was better than expected, considering the last minute booking and the “budget” price. When we arrived in our room, I realized that we had stayed in the same hotel about 9 or 10 years on a different floor and I recall that it was a bad experience. This hotel is a condominium hotel, which means that the rooms belong to individual owners or a time share. The hotel is located behind the Equus Hotel which manages the Marina Tower bookings. When arriving at the Marina Tower via a circular driveway, new guests must walk to the street-side lobby of the Equus Hotel to register. There is no notice anywhere on the Marina Tower building that directed us to do this (except a phone # posted to call for information) and the only way we found out was from another guest. Entrance into the Marina Tower lobby and hotel is with a security key only. Pros:Amazing views (26th floor)Lots of natural light in the roomHuge windows that opened almost all the way (no safety feature, so be careful with children)Fairly clean overall (no bugs)Clean bed linensKitchenette with full-size fridge, full range with oven, microwaveGood shower pressure, plenty of hot waterTV with many channelsFree wifi (which didn't work)Friendly registration at Equus Hotel0.3 mile walk from the Hilton Hawaiian Village (and conference)0.5 mile walk to the nearest beach0.3 mile walk to the Ala Moana Center0.3 mile walk to grocery store for fruits and vegetables and convenience foods½ block to bus stopCons:Kingsize bed needed to be replaced. I could feel the springs poking through the mattress.Wicker chairs were old and ready to be replaced.Tiny shower (approx. 3' x 4')Bathroom had mildewy smell.Stingy on towels: sometimes there would be wash cloths, at other times not; same with bath mat.Cleaning was spotty, mostly consisting of replacing used towels and emptying trash. I made my own bed three days in a row since the cleaning person did not show up until the afternoon. Bed linens were changed on the fourth day.Elevators were noisy and sounded like a jet taking off. This was especially disturbing at night.Elevators were a bit shaky and would inexplicably stop and linger at the 21st floor without the doors opening.Marina Tower lobby's artificial flower fragrance (infuser) was overpowering and head ache inducing. If other guests on the same floor were cooking, the aromas would drift into the hallway and into our room and linger. Even at the 26th floor there was a lot of street noise (traffic, sirens).I have been in many hotels, budget or luxury, in Waikiki over many years. This hotel was not out of the ordinary for a budget accommodation. You get what you pay for.

We arrived on New Year's Day for our long awaited vacation. We anticipated a clean, small room that would be cosy. The room was dirty, very old rickety furniture and old dated decor. The kitchenette was outdated with a leak under the sink. The view would have been great, but we couldn't stay in this nasty room. The place next door was an owner with nasty smells permeating through to us along with his loud music. Yes, the elevator was scary and very slow. It had a loud sound you could hear in the room. We went to the reception and they rebooked us into the Equus hotel, that was fabulous!

We like to think of ourselves as seasoned travellers and we have stopped in some pretty bad hotels and some amazing hotels over the years but I have got to say that this is right down there! Finding the hotel was the first problem as it's not sign posted at all. It turns out to be a tower behind another building. We arrived at 10am not expecting to get into our room and were told that we could have a lower floor room with partial ocean view right away but as we had booked a Deluxe Ocean View Room with king size bed we opted to wait till later to check in. The hotel kindly allowed us to leave our luggage and off we headed to explore the island. After returning early evening we checked in, received our room confirmation and key from the Equus hotel reception (who apparently manage the hotel which is set behind). We proceeded to the tower building and lift lobby leading to our hotel room. Alarm bells should have rung loudly when we noticed the pest control notification sign on the lift lobby wall indicating their next visit was January! We climbed aboard the slowest and most rickety lifts and proceeded upwards at a snails pace, passing outside and up the face of the building to floor 28. When we stepped out there were only 4 rooms per floor and the decor was pretty hideous and unwelcoming but that was nothing to what greeted us when we unlocked our Deluxe Ocean View Room..... it was like stepping back in time! We were greeted with a very dated interior, two twin beds - not a king or even queen bed in sight! The room was smelly and did not look anything like the pictures we had viewed on the internet (I will post some of possible)We decided to go back to the neighbouring hotel reception to complain and so back into the old rickety lifts once more to queue once again at the reception to be told that all rooms were full and nothing could be done tonight.... obviously lots of other unfortunate guests in the establishment. Resigned to being stuck here we got back in the lifts and upwards we went again.... our holiday gradually slipping away in the time machines otherwise known as lifts. To describe this as deluxe is stretching the definition to its absolute limits! We are currently here in this hotel 27th Dec 2014 wondering what went wrong! It's ok to stay somewhere knowing it is a little rough around the edges but when you book somewhere expecting one thing and receiving another you feel like you've been mugged. The shower sounds like the floor vibrates when you turn it on. The kitchenette looks like it's been in since the 70's. The twin beds have a single sheet as a cover and no sign of any blanket, which we've not experienced before! We have been told that they will try to move us tomorrow to a 'better' room however I'm not holding my breath as the whole of wikiki is booked up! Just wanted to warn other travellers that some of the other bad reviews are spot on this time which is very unfortunate for us but hopefully this will help others to not make the same mistake as us.

I recently stayed at this Hotel also known as the Waikiki Marina about a 10 minute walk to the The shopping Center just across the canal bridge. Waikiki Beach is less than 10 minutes a way walking and it has covered parking. I had a beautiful view and the accommodations were very comfortable and clean. It had a kitchenette with utensils. The people are very friendly with excellent rates. If it's available I will definitely stay there again. There are a few things you need to know though. There is no pool or exercise room and if you're on the higher floors you may find the outside elevators a little scarey with a bit of a wait time. The room I stayed in would certainly be comfortable for a couple but you would be a bit cramped because they are small but compact. The management must have responded favourably to the critics with complaints because I did not have the experiences mentioned. KUDOS to the Management.

I AM TERRIFIED OF ELEVATORS. THIS ELEVATOR HAD ME PRAYING and doing the Lamas Breathing Exercise saying Inch by Inch everything's a Cinch, I had to trick my mind and say floor 1 to 2, only 1 floor, 2 to 3, only 1 floor, 3 to 4 only 1 floor up to the 32nd floor. I've been stuck 3 times in an elevator and with this elevator being outside it does sway and get stuck. When we arrived were supposed to shower and go back out, I refused to go back down. Saved me money I guess but I told myself not to fall asleep, I was figuring out how can I get back down and escape and convince my husband how we could just forget the $348 we spent through AIRBNB.COM to David Roger's Royal Hawaiian Realty in room 3204. I woke up around 5am to the building moving, trade winds blowing strong enough to create sounds of sirens and just glad the dawn was coming so maybe I could really get us to go to another hotel and throw all that money away. Well had to end up enduring it and so each time we came back we stayed in with not a chance to use that terrifying elevator more than we had to. The last day I even got the security guard's phone number and emailed Mariah Dailey who is the manager for the sister building Equus on Sunday, she has since not replied to how frequent the elevator gets stuck and what people do in that instance if they're inside because it's not like someone can just open the elevator up and walk out, it's OUTSIDE!!! It was okay for me inside if you really ignore the water damage in the bathroom and the peep looking hole above the toilet. I was reading all the reviews while inside the Waikiki Marina. The thing about Airbnb is they make it seem like it's someone's residence so since you don't know 1700 Ala Moana is the same place as the Waikiki Marina because they don't tell you the address till you book. You also don't know about all the awful reviews on tripadvisor.com or yelp.com I say that's pretty misleading. Had I known that I would have booked directly through Hotels.com the $95 for 3 nights and paid $20 parking a night which would still have been less and I get credit for each stay with hotels.com Aside from feeling like this guy trusted us by giving us the lockbox combo, etc to the room, I feel taken. Air BNB should take places like this off their site. IT WAS TOO Pricey for a room you feel stuck in.

We've travel just about everywhere and this place is by far the worse place we've ever stayed. We plan to have a a relaxing holiday so I put a 'Do Not Disturb' sign on the door when we're in. First hour we are in the room came a knock on the door. Before I could answer two cleaning ladies just sprung in and wishing to change our alarm clock, me in my underpants and my husband was in the shower with the door open.Two days after we have to leave the room before 9:00 am because they are doing a pest control fumigation.The two lifts, only one was working in most days.Our room wasn't attended to for cleaning for the first 3 days.On the fourth day minimal cleaning was done, Just the bed was made, supply of fresh towel but no supply of toilet paper and had to request for some time be brought in.Then there come another notice informing us water supply won't be available from 10:00 am on one of the day.One of the day coming back from our day outing on the 5th day, a note was left on top of our bed saying ' I can not clean your room because you have personal property left in your bed' it was a sarong I left neatly folded on top of our bed. And by the way I made our bed everyday before leaving for the day.Then there was no cleaning at all after that.Then there come another knock on the door one early morning whilst 'No Disturb Sign' visibly in place, again, before we can answer the door, a man let himself in to change the ironing board.It was a total let down on our relaxing holiday plan.PS: for family with children's this place is not ideal. The window has no security screen or barrier when it's open and kids can climb to an open window and potentially can jump or fall fatally.

I would not stay again. found cockroaches ion kitchen. Bathroom with mold and slime in the shower. Very old kitchenette, outdated supplies, pots, pans, crockery. Outdated furniture. loud air-conditioning. Lift noise

And that's about it! The views from this centrally located tower are to die for but the rest :( The whole place is in dire need of refurbishment, it's way past it's use by date. The kitchenette was rusted and the toilet was jammed half under the vanity, so much so it dug in your back when you sat on it, besides having to be a contortionist to reach the toilet paper. Water pressure was barely adequate to wash your hair, and the lifts!! Well you have to wait an age for them, if they're both working. The bed was comfortable and the place was clean. The staff were helpful, if your only using it to sleep in, no problems. I've booked to stay there again on my next visit which is only overnight as the location is great for restaurants and shops. Just be aware before you check in, the place is old, oh and you have to chi in at the neighbouring hotel.

What an awful hotel/condo. Dirty rooms, constantly leaking faucet in the shower. Leaky fridge and loudest air conditioner ever! Surprise $25/day valet parking. Stayed on floor 15 = 10 minute wait for the 1 working elevator. Stay away!!!

We was check in at Nov 13 2014. That hotel was one of the tall buildings in that area. We are on the 37 floors. It's totally 40 floors. Hotel was really old. But stuff really nice. Hotel have really nice view on the 37 floors in day time you can see the marina and Waikiki Beach. In the night time you can see the Honolulu city.

My family went to this hotel a couple of weeks ago. The staff was amazing. My father-in-law is disabled, the did what the could to accommodate us even though it is not an ADA friendly hotel. When the elevator went down they did what they could to find us another place to stay. We were welcomed with juice and on the way out the houseman brought us a pineapple boat.

Our room was 3304. Pros are the location and the free parking!! Condo is with quite a nice view and next to a big shopping center. Room was small but clean, without any bugs and the kitchen was just a basic, but for 4 nights it was OK. It was not even so noisy during the nights. Anyway there were some things which should be repaired like broken window rail and lurking nails from the carpet next to paving. And only one elevator was working. Overall we were satisfied as we paid 500$ for 4 nights with free parking in a great location, but I wouldn't recommend it for long term stays.

I spent 2 days here in October, 2014. The location is good , everything is within walking distance. The condition of condotel is old and should be renovated. However,if you pay for 100+ USD/ night, you deserve that condition ! Single elevator worked very well although it might take 3-5 min to be ready. I didn't open air-condition, so I was not disturbed by its sound. The weather was fine and not hot. I had nice sleep every night. The only thing which could be improved instantly is front desk clerk. They would have been more helpful ! The hotel doesn't need to invest more , just change a new team front desk clerk.

The Marina Tower is a Condotel. Some residences are owned by the Marina Tower, others by residents who place them in a rental pool. This is obviously a fact lost on some guests. The rooms are not cookie cutter, each is different, and the condition of the rooms varies based upon the the owner. Whenever renting a vacation property due diligence is the key to a successful visit. We recently sold a home in Boston and relocated to Waikiki. We had previously stayed at the Equus, an adjacent property. Given that this was to be an extended stay we wanted a kitchenette so we contacted Mariah Dailey the General Manager at the Equus and Marina Tower. We explained our needs for a long term stay with a flexible check out date. Mariah was incredibly accommodating and arranged for us to reserve a room on the 34th floor with a full ocean view. When we arrived we were greeted by a staff member who presented us with a cool drink and a lei. The room was fully equipped with everything necessary for an extended stay: cooking and eating utensils, coffee pot and even a corkscrew. The view was incredible: rainbows, the Ilikai and Hilton Hawaiian Village Fireworks on Friday nights. The price was a third of comparable units in the vicinity. During our stay we were impressed by the friendliness of the staff and their efforts to make our stay as pleasant as possible. Lorenia Levya the General Manager of the property exhibited an attention to detail that was simply incredible. She provided us with change for the on premise laundry and even provided complimentary laundry detergent. On one occasion after a rain shower I found her mopping the entryway and elevator lobby. That is dedication!During our stay the elevators were an issue. One evening we did have to climb 34 flights of stairs to our suite, carrying a case of wine. It was an inconvenience but it was put in perspective by the performance the housekeeping and security staff. They were tasked with cleaning and securing the high rise without elevators and they performed marvelously and without complaint. We found a long term condo rental after two weeks in Honolulu, much to our surprise. When we informed the Marina Tower that we would leaving early there was absolutely no problem. Our deposit was refunded immediately. We would stay at the Marina Tower again and recommend it to our friends who plan to visit Honolulu.Mahalo nui loa, Mariah and Lorenia.

This was an emergency stay last July for 3 nights for my son and I while we were trying to find an apt for him. We had to re-book every night while we were waiting for an apt to open up. Rooms were dated, tho we stayed in 3 different ones - and some were better than others, so there is a great difference in some of them. They were all bigger rooms than most other hotels, and had lots of large storage. The kitchen was nice - again, first one we stayed in was pretty old and sad looking, and the last two pretty good. Everything was clean, although in the first room there were tiles broken and rusty stove and needed new paint and carpet stained, so it looked pretty pathetic. The next two we stayed in were nicer, with newer appliances, and good carpet and paint. The wi fi was good, and free. The people were really nice, and Rene at the front desk was really helpful and nice. We had first booked the room through Hotwire, but then had to keep booking for two more nights, and we just did it through her for the other nights and it was cheaper. It is close to the beach, although you have to walk around the marina a little ways to the left to get to the sand beach, and around to the right to get to Ala Moana park. But not a bad walk, and close by, maybe 3 short blocks altogether. Another nice thing was that they had free MaiTais a couple of nights in the deck/lobby area. It is also close to food, McDonalds and Dennys is right up the street, and lots of other choices right there close like Red Lobster and Outback. They have two buildings, and it is a little confusing because you have to check in at the Equis which is actually in front of the Marina Tower, but that isn't too difficult to do. The prices are good, it was the least expensive we could find, on short notice, and for $99, you can't really expect a lot. They are all independently owned, so some are better than others. As I said, the rooms are large with lots of storage for boogie boards or chairs or beach stuff. The whole wall is cabinets that connect, so storage isn't a problem. The bad things are that some of the rooms are not nice looking, although they are clean. The first night I thought there was dirt - but it was just the paint and worn tile that made it look dirty. The beds were also comfortable, and the linens were clean and fresh and I appreciated that. For the money, I was very happy - although it isn't the Marriott!! The kitchenette was especially nice to have - with the prices of food over there, that was really a plus, and added a lot to the value of the room. You can't usually get a hotel room there with a kitchenette, you have to rent a condo, which are more expensive. The one thing I really missed though, was not having a lanai. I like to sit out on a balcony as often as possible, and there are none here. Also, apparently some of the rooms have views, but ours didn't. It wasn't bad, you just couldn't see the ocean from where we were. But it was clean and cheap, and close to everything, and they had rooms available every night, so that made it good for us!! I think that you can ask to move rooms if they have them available, or you can upgrade in price to get a better one. They are all different, so I think that if there was one in the same category they would let you switch for no more money.

Wish i had known about tripadvisor before i booked this room !Our room was a kitchenette, clearly not the one shown on the website. it consisted of an unclean stove top and microwave oven, king size mattress with an oversize lump of foam on top, Hotel is desperately in need of a face lift and update, one lift does not work at all and apparently has been like that for a long time, On one occasion we waited for 20 minutes on the 39th floor for the only working lift, as a result we missed our tour bus trip for a luau, and then had to get a taxi there costing $65, when i spoke to reception about it they offered me $5 towards the fare !! On one occasion we were left stranded on the 39th floor when the lift broke down and we had to walk down the stairs, on another day after getting back from a tour we had the option of waiting about an hour for the lift to be repaired or climbing the stairs all the way to 39 .Also had an overflowing toilet, had to use the towels to stop it escaping out of the bathroom, they came and sorted it fairly quickly, took away the towels and promised to bring replacements, they never came !!Room had a musty smell like the carpet had been wet ,do yourself a favor, pay a little extra and get a motel you'll enjoy staying at

If they don't fix the lifts, only stay here if you like climbing stairs! We stayed here for a week and during this time one lift was totally out of order (and I believe has been so for ages) and the second lift kept breaking down. We were on the 27th floor and had to twice walk up to our unit and three times needed to walk downstairs. On the day we left we had to lug our suitcases down 27 flights of stairs! If the lift is fixed then we recommend unit 2704. Sure, the decor was a bit dated but it was clean and had all we needed. The air conditioning is a bit noisy but effective. Free wifi. The view was great and it is an easy walk to the beach, the Ala Moana shopping centre and downtown. There is an ABC Store downstairs that has most things you might need. For its price it would be hard to beat this condo.

I can't even begin to lie and say that the views from this hotel, if you can really call it that, were not very nice, because they were, but that is all they have to offer.I checked in late Sunday night after performing my best man duties fro my two best friends wedding at Secret Beach and attending a luau at Paradise Cove. The first red flag should have been all the trick photography, my friends showed after we had to book a last minute room for me. The next re flag should have been the fact that there is no such location. This place is more condos, than it is a hotel and some of the "rooms" they show are of condos that are rented by the owners of each condo, not the so called hotel.Check in is crazy, because there is no check in desk for this location. You must check in at another hotel, which means lugging your bags up a flight of stairs, then back down to the very back of the lot. You're handed a door clicker that looks like a car alarm device.It was late and I was tired, but there was only one elevator working with 11 people waiting in front of me. This is when i learned that these people lived in the building and they were more than happy to give me all the dirt on the place. Like "bed bugs" "mice" and having to wait long periods of time for the elevators. They even warned me about flooding.I waited 15 minutes before I was finally able to get on the elevator to the 35 floor. When I walked into the rood it was hot as hell, so right away I looked for the air conditioner, I was shocked to see the old school square, accordion style unit mounted with wood in the corner of the window. I turned it on and right away I saw the light that says "service filter" come on. After 45 minutes at the lowest setting, the room was still like a sauna.The toilet in the bathroom was filled with water and had human waste in it. I called the front desk and I was told it would be taken care of in the morning. There was only one towel in the room.The bed was horrible, I could feel every single coil and wire in it. It was like sleeping on two stacked box springs. There were no cover on the bed, just sheets and no cover were located in the roomThe next morning when "house keeping finally arrived they acted surprised that someone was in the room, telling me that were told i was moved to another room. This is when I called the front desk (other hotel) again. That was yet another problem. In most hotels you simply dial the front desk by pressing 0, but here I had to make a phone call. Again I was told it would be taken care of. By the time I came back from a full day of exploring the counter was filled with water and the floor was soaked. the toilet had once again overflowed, but this time the wall had water running down it. You could actually here the water collecting and dripping in the space above the toilet. The shower only gave nearly cold water and again there were no toiletries left in the room. However there were plenty of towels which I had to use to soak up all the water on the floors.By morning water was leaking from the ceiling in the main room and running down the counter near the microwave which also did not work and seeping from behind the mirror. Calling the front desk was no longer an option because now the phone in the room did not work.I called my friends Tina and Andy who stayed at the Prince across the street and told them what was happening. I checked out two hours early to join them in their AWESOME hotel.This place is a complete dive, the hotel manager would not come to the front desk to speak with me and they refused to give me a check out receipt. One of the guys was in such a hurry to get me out so others could not hear my complaints, but two couples checking in asked me and I was all too happy to tell and show them what took place my two nights.If you find yourself in Waikiki, this place is not where you want to stay. No matter how cheap it is or even if they give it to you for free. I will post the videos to my youtube channel

The room was small and cozy with good views. But the room was very outdated! There were a lot of things needed to be fixed or replaced! The ironing board was ripped. The floor boards in the bathroom needs replaced. The shower curtain needs replaced. The walls had scratch marks all over and needs new paint. The closet door needs replacing. There was also a musty smell in the room! The room was just not very clean!!! Very disappointed for a first time visitor to Honolulu!

Stayed in room 904. Worst experience ever. Lifts didn't work, bugs everywhere, ac broken and noisy, hadn't been cleaned (hair and dirt everywhere) broken facet in bathroom, cracked benchtop in bathroom. It almost ruined our honeymoon. So disappointed. Paid $230 a night for a back packers room.

I had the time of my life on the 36th floor. They really rolled out the red carpet. Everything was in perfect order. I lived in a private condo that had every little detail in place, flowers, fine china, granite countertops and a really hot shower. The views are exquisite, I can't wait to get back to Paradise.

I stayed at Marina for one week. I was on the 36th floor - that was scary. I was offered the 10th floor. When I checked it out - the 36th floor was not so scary any more. On that floor I had the ocean view. I could see an ocean liner heading out to sea - wow! Inside was nicely furnished, including the kitchenette - my taste - wow! I liked that. That shimmering elevator on the side of the building made me fix my eyes and admire the numbers until the elevator finally stopped and the door finally opened on my floor. It was 'freedom time'. I was very relieved! After 2 or 3 days I began to look out at and admire the view and hope I was going to make it to the top. I did not interact much with the staff, but the few times I did, they were quite pleasant. All except for the clerk who admitted me at the concierge. It's a place I can return to again. It is also close to a major shopping centre - the Ala Moana Centre.

For a little over $100 this offers excellent value. Our room is spacious and well appointed. Free wi Fi, good aircon., cable TV, 4 stove cooktops with oven, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, fridge, pots and pans, basic cutlery, microwave, range hood, iron and ironing board. small but adequate ensuite, desk and table with separate chairs, very large storage space. On Ala Moana Boulevarde close to the Ali Wai canal and 1 block off the beach with some ocean views.

We found this place via the web. I wanted a condo fairly close to the beach that wouldn't cosy an arm and a leg. Although a bit run down, the room was clean and functional. We had a problem with the first room as I am terrified of heights and they moved us to a lower floor. Very accommodating and friendly staff.

Justin was very helpful , he provided what we need in our room same day when we arrived and Fely did an excellent job cleaning our room. Walking distance to the beach and all amenities, good location! The elevator was too slow and window curtain must be changed or cleaned.

When we called the owner of the room where we originally had booked our stay to find out how we check in, she told us that we could not stay there because of plumbing issues. I don't know when she planned on letting us know! She could not find a room for us at that time and we did not find out the name of it until the morning that we left our condo on the Big Island and it was owned by a friend of hers. Unfortunately, the taxi driver at the airport never heard of the place & dropped us off at the wrong building. The valet, security officer & concierge at the building where we were left at, never heard of the other place either. After calling her, she came down to the building & walked us & our luggage to our location, about a block down, having to cross the busy main street. The room was made to look nice with some furnishings and décor, but on closer inspection we found it to be old, dirty, roughly finished in some areas & not finished in other areas, half the outlets did not work, the dishes & utensils left there were filthy, and it was very crowded and extremely noisy. There was no lanai as we had booked at our first place, as it had been enclosed in the room cutting drastically on the size of the room. The lamps had old plugs from the 50's, & half didn't work. The outlets by the stove did not work nor did half of the other outlets. It was so scary & gross we ate out the entire time which defeated the point of having a kitchen available. The bathroom fan was inside the shower and we were afraid of getting shocked. Also the shower head was too low for my husband. The view was next to nothing, which was complete opposite of what we had booked initially. The 2 elevators were right by our room & extremely loud & ran until after midnight every night as there is 40 floors. It was so bad that we had to sleep with ear plugs in! We were told that this was a quieter & nicer end of Waikiki beach, the building was newer & our room was nicer. We have to disagree from what we experienced. This was very disappointing.

Staff were fairly unhelpful and cleanliness of room was very bad. Cockroaches regularly running around the room and kitchen area, we stayed on the 37th floor the view was stunning and its in a good location but bitterly disappointed how clean the room was.

We found this place through Google's travel search (pretty decent), and confirmed our choice with more reviews through other travel sites.It is indeed an old building, but one would be fooled based on the chic check-in desk at The Equus Hotel. It's a bit of a weird setup, but The Equus seems to own/maintain The Marina Tower (which does not have a front desk). It was our 1 year anniversary (it's not much of a milestone), and they made it a special one by upgrading us to the 39th floor with an ocean view, just 1 floor under the penthouse. The staff at the desk were always friendly and helpful whenever we approached them. Needless to say, we were pretty floored by the gesture and was further floored by the great view. It would be a 'spectacular' view, but other hotels blocked the full view of the ocean and beaches. You do get a glimpse of Ala Mona Park/beach and the Hilton Lagoon though, which are exquisite specimens of paradise.The A/C was horrible, and is really the only investment most necessary to be upgraded. One really neat thing though, is that the room came with a freezer chest! Upon this discovery, we had to get some ice cream.The room was clean but a bit dingy. Few of the power outlets did not work, but we got by. Elevators are indeed the slowest around, and makes some of the worst noises for anyone that is afraid of heights.All in all, you get what you pay for. But in our case, we got some special accommodations! Great location - minutes from Ala Mona Mall and the Convention Center. A 10minute walk to the start of the Waikiki strip. Also right across from the Hilton, which is a fun place to visit even if you're not staying there (they don't check if you're staying, so you can pretty much use all their amenities).I'd highly recommend this place if you're on a budget and just want a place to rest your head for the night.

I can only speak to my experience with the facility as a whole and not as a hotel room, since I rented a condo unit within the building that is privately owned. Pros: this place is in a great location that's within walking distance of Waikiki and the Ala Moana shopping center. For rooms on the south side of the building, there is an almost-great view of the ocean that's blocked by a few high-rises. The swimming pool is very small, but it's well-maintained.Cons: based on my discussion with other guests who did have a hotel room there, I know that their room layout was the same as ours. The window-mounted A/C unit was extremely noisy and failed to regulate the room temp well. I spent every night alternating between turning on the A/C or opening the window. The room is also very oddly shaped with a ledge about 3' from the ground that juts into the room and eliminates about 30 square feet of usable space. The 2 elevators are agonizingly slow. The fact that they have absolutely no ventilation coupled with glass walls which are fully exposed to the sun most of the day make the slow ride tortuous. In this case, you really get what you pay for. Location: 10, comfort: 3. I would not stay here again.

When I checked in the front desk was very courteous. Kudos to him. The room was upgraded to a ocean view with two beds. When I got in the room the beds were the size of my kids bunk beds, and the counter had a dead German roach on it. (Bad entry). I then killed two more as they made breaks for my fruit I bought later that day. The next day I found one more in the bathroom, and squashed him promptly. Third day in and I wake up with one in the bed with me! I ask the front desk what is the policy on checking out and just paying for my night's there, but I booked through agoda, and if I checked out early they would bill me for one more night on my card. Not cool man. Lesson learned, don't book through agora and sometimes a deal means you have to "deal" with it... Bad maneuver.

I booked a room at the equuis hotel and I needed to change rooms to one that would be quiter then the one I was in.I asked the hotel staff could they honor my request and they did with no issues and I was very pleased, The staff is ALWAYS nice and helpful everytime I have stayed. I would HIGHLY recomend the hotel to my friends, It has an excellent location and if you request a room with an ocean view they delivered 110% I stayed in room 3701 all I can say is WOW! and thank you. So if you want a stress free hotel experience I would recomend you try this Hotel

A great view from the room at a more accessible price. We were nicely welcomed with the traditional shells lei and with nice pineapple in the room.The elevators offer a spectacular view when going up to your room. The beach is really 5 min to walk.Unfortunately during the night I saw some bugs coming out from the kitchenette which is not really nice.

This is a funny hotel, it's part of a complex of 3, so you enter via Equus, which was confusing to start with. I booked through Agoda, they had difficulty finding the reservation.The bus boy was excellent and very friendly, stored our luggage while we waited for check in, nothing was too much trouble for him.My friend's room looks like it was renovated recently, mine wasn't.Neither of us had hair dryers, so had to request - just a nuisance really.We both had partial views of the beach - they were great views on the 36th floor. And the other good thing is only 4 rooms per floor so no outside noise.Inside noise from the air con however, was atrocious.Bed very soft, if you like that...But very clean.

Ok I recently rented one of the unit on this building and so happy that I moved out after my first month after convincing my owner that this location doesn't fit my needs. Don't get me wrong, the location is great. Other than that,this building is a Chaos.. First is the Elevator,it's been broken for like 2 weeks or so and same as the garage. I was late for work on my first day after I moved here due to only one slow elevator working. Second is the garage door broken and your car is not safe at all. Third is when your trying to get a hold of the manager he doesn't know how to answer the phone and not in the property most of the time. Yes I did tried multiple times to go downstairs and talk to him but he's not there. Lights are on but no manager. Fourth is, it's seems like they charge everything here, me and my coworkers would like to BBQ and use the pool but for some reasons the Manager will charge you to use the buildings BBQ grill? It seems like he's trying to make some Nickel and Dimes on the side..This is the first time I heard of this..I thought that's free if your renting here. I don't wanna sound cheap but damn.. Oh and the swimming pool looks like its never been cleaned at all..The water looks really dirty. If your trying to find a place to stay in Hawaii. I will highly NOT recommend this Waikiki Marina Hotel. I definitely regret staying here.. Sorry for the bad review but I'm just speaking the truth.

The view from our room on the 38th floor was amazing! Room was very clean with an updated kitchenette. The staff is amazing and treat you like part of their Ohana. Location is great with many places to eat within walking distance. Mahalo Nui Loa to Jacquie and the staff!!

Don't be deceived by the enthusiastic welcome by Puka at Reception. My requested booking for a harbour view in Moana Tower ( had paid additional for this to occur) was disputed by Puka who was too lazy to refer back to confirmation sent to me by Clifton which was documented on computer so was allocated Room# 607 with a view into another adjoining building!!Whats more Puka was loose with the truth, as according to Clinton, Puka stated that I was happy in #607 which was far from the truth!! Following much discord with other Reception staff, when finally Clinton came on duty for late shift, he in fact confirmed that there had been a room reserved for me in the Tower but at such a late hour declined as too much of an effort to move as it was only an overnight stay BUT it left a bad taste!!! Room # 607 was a refurbished older style motel type off a covered walkway along the internal side of the building, which had been updated. The room was spacious, with American style colonial décor- pleasant décor, furnishing. Had a balcony with a side view of Alamoana Blvd which had constant traffic noise. On arrival shower recess floor was covered in a "white substance' ?? cleaning agent! where was the quality control?? When I eventually found the maid it was rectified quickly. That aside it was a pleasant ( don't know about being ';boutique")place to stay in close proximity to shopping mall, short distance to beach and other attractions. Poor WIFI reception. It is a pity that on this occasion the likes of Puka marred the overall experience. Clinton was so efficient and helpful.

Great place if your looking for something cheap and close to waikiki and ala moana. Staff were excellent and friendly especially Jacquie and Poku. Room was abit funny smelling and needed airing everyday and there was a lot of windsound we weren't sure where that was from. The cleaning lady was great and really appreciative of any tips. Thanks guys for the time we had we had fun!

I give this hotel an "Average" because it is a clean comfortable place with decent security (fob locks on the door, but no security staff). The tower is tall, over 30 stories so the views from the top are amazing. Looks out over the Marina area, if you are familiar with the Waikiki area, you cannot see the fireworks from the rooms-other direction views. The lobby is small and the elevators somewhat cramped-but they are glass backed so they do not 'feel claustrophobic". The location is great at the lip of Waikiki just between the Hawaiian Village and the Ala Moana Mall, easy walk to both at 1-2 blocks, It is also right on the Aloha Double Decker sightseeing and Da Bus line - easy to other points on the island. The walk into the heart of Waikiki is beautiful along park and beach, but it is 1 mile to the International Market, 1.6 to The Duke Kahanamoku Statue/Zoo area and 2 mi to the Aquarium (although completely walk-able with beach, shops and eateries all along the way).

Both my colleague and I had the same experience when booking this hotel: Saw tons of great reviews, booked, then when it got closer, suddenly encountered hundreds of terrible reviews.Believe the terrible ones!Our first clue should have been when our cab driver from the airport had never heard of it. Our second clue should have been when we had to check in at a DIFFERENT hotel (you check in at the Equus). And our third clue should have been the confusion over whether or not people actually can/do live here year round. Then we should have known.We knew when we got to the "suite" we had booked-- and it was just a single, bizarrely shaped room with a baffling crawlspace beneath the window. We knew when the air conditioner could not control temperature at all and was so loud that we couldn't hear each other speak over it. We knew when the light in the shower sounded like a swarm of bees was dying inside it.It's weird-- you recognize all the things from the photos you've seen, but everything is just slightly off enough that you know you're in for trouble. And the bad reviews are all accurate: the elevators break all the time (at least three times during our weeklong stay), there are little fruit flies everywhere, the parking is expensive. There are some redeeming factors: the hot tub is really nice, the pool is heated comfortably. The location is hell of convenient to the Convention Center.It got the job done. But it's the kind of place we'll be recalling with some incredulity for years to come!

We stayed 6 days 11-16 March 2013 in this hotel. We took full ocean view. We booked the package from Expedia. Below are my comments.Ocean view is goodRoom is good.Bed is good. Easy access to restaurants, shopping center etc.Staff was nice and friendly.I saw ants in the kitchen which is not good.shower/bath area is very small.Hotel/rooms seems to be old.Parking is expensive.Overall it is good hotel for the price.
