San Mateo, California, United States

review_body: The tower is a 40 story right on Ala Moana at the marina, every room good views, store on corner, restaurants, busses everything walking distance. Staff was very friendly and the pool and spa were quiet and secure. A good location for walking or public transportation as parking is quite expensive.

Stayed March 6-12, 2013 in room 3820, fabulous view, bed was new and very comfy, they replaced noisy air conditioner immediately when we asked, room clean and spacious. Re. Jswansons entry yesterday - notice of the 4-hour water shut off for servicing was posted in advance by the elevator for days - you missed it. Great location - we walked to everything in Waikiki. Had very hard time finding the place in first instance but great value for the price. Slept with the window open 2 nights but street noise a bit much - zero noise issue with window closed. Pool area a bit in the shade. Hot tub ok. Did very thorough check for bed bugs & found none. No lanai but huge window opens for a great outdoor feel. Moved to Sheraton for last 2 nights to burn off some points - much nicer but more than 2x the price. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Staying in the towers at this moment and there has been no water since 8AM till now and I need to shower so bad before my big meeting. I'm here for work and this situation is not helping me out at all. The water problem, slow elevators that sounds like its about to give up and ice machine that is like probably 30yrs old and smells like sewer!!! All I can say is don't stay here and I will NOT recommend for people to spend money to stay on this property. Worst experience ever..

Stayed 2 days only, Feb. 22/23, 2013. Staff were very nice. BUT, NICE, doesn't make up for a worn out tired hotel. Very noisy elevators, lousy beds, but if you want a hotel for under $200 per night The location was great.

I'll bet no one has invested in this hotel since the sixties, and 50+ years of wear is showing signs. My wife and I could smell a strong odor of decay in the walls, which were patched in many locations. I found two little cockroach looking bugs (SEE PICTURE), one crawling across the night stand, and one trapped in the bathroom sink that couldn't get out. The air conditioner was terribly rusty, old, and loud. The front desk said there were no facilities like a gym available. I could go on and on, but you get the picture. My wife and I are not without our kids much, and we were going to be there on Valentines day, but I checked us out the very next morning to try to salvage out time in Hawaii. WARNING: If you are traveling with kids BEWARE of the windows. They open easily, and even the upper floors do not have something to allow parents to lock the windows, or even screens, and it is a long way down.

I particularly like the help of Jacquie and Renee on the first night.Cable provider was switched to Hawaiian Telecom that day.We had no signal to provide TV services and for personal computer.Jacquie tried numerous times to rectify the problem. She was extremely polite and helpful. She called others for assistance during that first night. She did her best.The next day when we returned to the room all services were restored. Believe her follow-up was responsible.Thank you for your attention.Sincerely,Clyde Okuda, Hotel guest

Location was fantastic, as was the price. Talking to others I gathered these were condos owned by individuals, so I'm also going to assume that the quality of the furnishings may vary. I always find it interesting that owners will invest in a new flat-screen TV, before upgrading a horrid mattress which probably witnessed Elvis' glory days in Hawaii. I was happy with every aspect of this choice as an independent traveler who shuns resorts, except for of course the mattress which made my sleep memorable in its discomfort. I would stay here again, would hope for a different unit.

My boyfriend and I decided to go to Hawaii for our first anniversary, and found that the Equus Hotel and Marina Tower was offering an excellent price for the time that we went (beginning of November). We picked the Full Ocean View, and when we got there we were able to pick the perfect room that we wanted -- very friendly staff. The view was amazing (we were in the Marina Tower on the 36th floor facing the ocean). Every morning he would wake me up and remind me, haha.The hotel staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. They even helped me organize an anniversary present being delivered to our room when we were out, complimentary wine, etc. Overall, an awesome time.In the hotel itself, there wasn't a lot to do beyond admiring the view, but it's convenient central location (and the view) made it totally worth it.

When we looked at the add for Equus Hotel & Marina Tower, (as advertised at that time), we saw ocean views & a kitchenette. This is what we requested. Different to what we got. When we mentioned this to the management, they said it would cost more to stay in the Marina Tower, & was not available for a few days. We got the access code for the building, key card for the room. The elevator is really rickety, and the room very musty. We decided to stay in the hotel, with nokitchenette or view of the ocean from our room. We were in room 1004, half way along on top floor. If you wanted to stand out on the walkway to the rooms, you could see the marina. Not how it was advertised, nor what we paid for.Hotel rooms a very front have very partial ocean view, and I mean partial. Other rooms look directly into apartment building. Be careful, as two buildings (hotel) & (Marina Tower). We will not recommend, nor go back.

My Husband and I stayed at Marina Tower in October 2012 for 4 nights.Rene, the manager, was wonderful. As my husband and I were eloping in Hawaii, Rene was extremely helpful and assisted us with organising everything. We were given a welcome drink on arrival and an early check in time which was greatly appreciated after 20 hours of travelling. We were also given an upgrade to a fabulous room on the 36th floor. The view was breath taking. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The staff also sent us a bottle of champagne and a pineapple to celebrate our wedding, a beautiful touch.This hotel is in a fantastic location - one block from the beach and close to heaps of restaurants and shops.My husband and I will most definately return to this wonderful hotel.Mahalo to Rene and all the staff.AB

I'm here for vacation right now and the elevator is broken (again!). I will definitely not coming back here again. Staff are great but the building is crap. I have to wait 15-20 mins for the elevator and this is ridiculous! Very unacceptable..

We really enjoyed our stay here. Our room in the Marina Tower was just like in the picture, and the ocean view was magnificent. We appreciated having the kitchenette with full size fridge and stove. The location was very close to the Ala Moana Beach and Mall, but within walking distance to the Waikiki beach.The only draw back was traffic noise when the window was open, but traffic tapered off by 11pm. We had the breakfast package, which was at a nearby restaurant. The food was fine, but not worth the extra money. Also, we found out our last day that there were beach towels available at the front desk. Beats using our own every day.

We spent 4 days in the marina tower, the view was amazing on the 36 th floor.As they have a tennis court we wanted to play a round so we called the reception. " no problem" was the anseer so we got ready to pick up the tennisrackets at the reception as instructed. After 5 min. We were told that they only had one racket.. Ok... So we went back in our room to get ready for something else. The next day we called the reception to ask for the key for the safe deposit box. Again "no problem, the key is ready to be picked up" ok... 36 floors down (elevator needs some time) and to the reception. Once arrived they started with the searching.. Again after a couple of minutes we were told that they could not find the key but I should go back to my room and they will call me so I can pick it up.. Of course.. That was also the reason why i flew to hawaii and wait for the phonecall which obviously never came. In the evening i went back to the reception to ask if it was there now.. Again 5 min waiting and no key. One day after they sent the locksmith who was not able to open the box... Well that was about it.. No excuse, no nothing.. Would definately not go back.

Located across Ala Moana Blvd from the Prince Hotel, the ultra-convenient location is halfway between Waikiki beach and the Ala Moana Mall (certainly one of the best shopping malls in America, and only a five minute walk away !) There is a excellent supermarket located in the mall, and another (Don Quixote) close-by. Ala Moana Mall also serves as the main bus depot for Oahu. The unit (#3301) has amazing panoramic ocean view looking southwest, rainbows are seen almost every morning. The unit itself does not feel small because of this open view. Note that the windows slide completely open so comforting Hawaiian breezes can be enjoyed day and night, making the air-conditioning unnecessary. There is a efficient working desk set-up. The WiFi internet connection is usually strong and very dependable, and the flat-screen TV has most cable channels. There is a small dining table with two chairs that easily tucks away when not in use. The kitchen is outfitted very well, including a blender and hot-plate... as well as two small refrigerators. There is also an ice-machine available on the ground level. The bathroom shower is clean and the hot water constantly available. The towels supplied are quite adequate, but you might want to bring your own. The king-size bed is very comfortable indeed... but NOTE: the bed linens supplied are inadequate and you will need to bring your own king-size sheets, or purchase cheap linens close-by at either Walmart or Ross (both are located two blocks north of the Ala Moana mall). The building itself is clean and kept in very good repair. The manager and security staff were very friendly and efficient. The swimming pool is wonderful, and very clean... and receives plenty of sun from mid-morning till mid-afternoon. The glass elevators outside the back of the condo tower offers view of the entire Waikiki. It is a short walk to the beach and the Hilton Hawaiian Village, and to Fort DeRussy Park. In September the trees and bushes throughout Honolulu were all in bloom. This condo is highly recommended, and is certainly one of the best options for an extended stay in Honolulu.

My family and I stayed in Equus for 9 days. We stayed in room 3201 and 3203; both rooms had a kitchens which we used for cooking breakfast burritos. My only complaint is that the rooms were a little bit smaller than i hoped otherwise everything else was fine. My parents favorite part was the very big, almost scary windows that overlook the beach. I thought the beds were very comfortable although they were just a little small for my big brother, who is 185cm tall. by:khoaster

review_body: The staff was more than generous, but I would have paid more for a nicer room had I known the pics on their website were so misleading. I won't stay at the Equus (Condo Hotel) again when I go back to Waikiki... the rooms were older and needed work... the $1000 they received from me after my 10 day stay would help pay for the fix-ups this place needs, but they are clearly not putting the revenue back into this property. I did have a great view of Waikiki beach so I am thankful for that, and the hotel is just a 10 minute walk from the Ala Moana Shopping Center where we loved the food court! All in all, not too impressed, but it was one of the lower priced hotels in that area, so it goes to show you get what you pay for.

review_body: I wish we had the great treatment that many people had said they had, but it was just average to me but it could have been worse. The marina tower is a condo hotel, so there are people that actually live there. Cutting to the chase, we ended up getting our car towed while staying there in their garage. The communication on how the parking worked at this hotel was not clear and in the end our car got towed and we had to foot the bill ($187 plus cab fare) to get it back. We got in on Thursday, the guy there that night said they we were full on parking at their place, so we parked at the hale Koa garage ( about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel) since I was a DOD employee. The next day Friday, was another guy, named Jason and I asked about parking and he said yes they did have parking and ask for my room number. Gave him the room number and he handed me a a piece of paper of what looked like a receipt to me and then he hands me the garage key with the parking stall number for us to park. He asked for our license plate and I gave it to him. During all of this not once did he mentioned to make sure that the paper he gave me was to be displayed in car or the Garage key with the stall number to be displayed in the car. Again, I thought it was a receipt because when I tried to pay him for the stay of the parking, he told me to hold on to it until check out. We go to find the parking spot and a car was all ready in it. I go back to tell him this and he said to just park anywhere it says Hotel guest parking. Come to find out later in the vacation, that car was a resident at the marina tower and he had a special tag on his car. So we parked in whatever spot we could find with the Hotel Guest parking sign for three nights, Friday, Saturday and Sunday night, Monday 1030am we go to the garage to find out our car is gone! We go to the front desk, where I tell Athena, our car is missing. She asked for the room number and then repeated the license plate to us and I said yes that is our car. She tells it got towed because they thought it was trespassing because there was no tag on it. I told her we never give a tag, then she asked me about the paper that I thought was a receipt and that is when i mentioned to her that Jason did not tell us about that. Athena said that was the parking pass or the garage key that had the stall number attached. In any case, she called us the cab and wrote what tow company they called. I did not understand how our car got towed if we parked there for 3 nights with no issue. Also, they did had signs about the parking but for some reason I did not put two and two together and thought it was for the people living at the marina tower. I wanted to speak with the manager after we got our car back but was told they would not be in until Tuesday. Tuesday came, talked with Rene, and she was sorry about had happen. She meet with me half way and refunded us through hotels.com (that is where we booked through) a night stay and we got a pineapple boat. All this time, I couldn't understand what was the point then of giving our license plate if they where only going to look in the car to see if it had a piece of paper or tag. We stopped parking there the rest of our week vacation and parked at the hale koa garage. Note: Doesn't matter what hotel you stay in Waikiki have to pay for parking so make sure you put that into your budget, $15-20 a night.So the moral of this whole experience, pay attention to the signs carefully, and if you are parking in any garage anywhere, display your receipt/ticket/ whatever it is they give you because you will get towed. As for the the rooms, it was not bad, we didn't stay in it all day of course, just needed it to sleep and shower. I think the Equus has the nicer rooms that everyone is speaking of, we stayed in the marina tower the ones with the kitchens. I am unsure if I would stay here again. Like I said it was not bad, could have been worse, but did not get the amazing treatment that most people said they got.

I booked this hotel off hotwire after reading many good reviews about it. I was staying in the Marina tower with a kitchenette and partial ocean view. I'm a very easy going person but since I paid extra for the kitchenette and view, I expected a little more than what I got. The kitchenette was incomplete (did not have a cutting board, dish cloth or dish soap) and the one pot and pan were very old and scratched up. As for the view, waikiki beach/ ala moana park were blocked by several huge buildings. We could see the ocean, but only a little bit. Also, the phone didn't work and the parking garage remote wasn't even the right one so it didn't work. In the morning I went down to reception and asked for kitchenette supplies and for someone to repair the phone. I was gone the entire day, got back in the evening, and nothing had been brought up or fixed. Since the phone didn't work, I had to go all the way down to reception (they had 2 elevators, one of which was having problems, so only 1 worked and it was a 10 minute wait). I asked the front desk guy for kitchenette supplies, etc. and he had an apathetic attitude while calling someone to my room. He also replaced my parking garage remote, which only worked from time to time (when it didn't, a security guard would have to open it for us).In the hotel I bumped into several people who were pretty pissed off about the service and ill-equipped rooms. I have no idea why this hotel ranks so highly. I have had better times in hostels and couch surfing than here.

I had purchased this Groupon for this hotel and got a room in the tower. We had the partial ocean view which was a gorgeous view!!! Because we were in the tower we also got rights to the swimming pool and hot tub. And even though there isn't a gym in the Equus, the Illikai has a small gym that is for guests of the tower (Illikai also manages the rental of some of the condos). Yes, the carpets and furniture were old and a little gross but I knew that coming in from reading the reviews. We didn't have any problems with bugs and we found the Equus staff to be, for the most part, very pleasant. The breakfast is nothing much and the food disappears quickly. This was very centrally located and the beach that is close is just gorgeous. You can walk to the mall and there are some good neighborhood restaurants around here if you are willing to do some research.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago on our first trip to Hawaii together for my birthday...and it was by far the WORST hotel experience we've ever had. EVER.There were some major issues including:-No water for 15 hours, when the hotel said it would be around 3 or 4.-BUGS (gigantic ones!) everywhere in the room. Alive and crawling.-They moved us to a room that had no bed.Overall, the decor looks nothing like the pictures online. It is about as disappointing as you can expect--very dirty, old furnishings and tiles, no bathtub, limited amount of pillows and towels, cranky loud elevator. Everything looks like it came from the 60s--old and needs lots of updating. The free "continental breakfast" was a complete joke--slices of bread, one type of fruit, and small amounts of juice and coffee is NOT appropriate and certainly nothing to promote. They don’t even have basic amenities like a hair dryer & shampoo and their tiny 2 ounce bar of soap had holes in the wrapper. I can only imagine how old that soap was!Seems like the housekeeping and maintenance departments don't speak very good English either. We had an issue with our shower stall (this was after they got the water back on after 15 hours), where the water didn't turn on and the hot and cold knobs didn't work properly, and we called somebody up to work on it. The guy spent almost 2 hours trying to fix it and finally said that he'd have to come back the next day because he couldn't fix it right then. Hence, our plans for the evening changed because we weren't able to take a shower for 2 days. My husband went down to the front desk many, many times to inquire about the water situation and the staff was not very responsive. It seems like communication wasn't a big importance at this place.We were so angry about the whole situation that we called Priceline, the company that we booked the package through and spoke with a rep and demanded a refund, and he informed us that he'd have to contact the hotel first to see what they can do. After awhile, they said the hotel was only able to refund back one night....which was certainly not enough for the horrible experience!!!Disgusting. Atrocious. That's how I'd describe this hotel. PLEASE save your money and go somewhere else...anywhere else is better than this one. The only good thing I can say about this place was the close proximity to Waikiki and the beach. But then again, there are many MANY other hotels close to the beach that are much better than this one. Please do not stay here

We had stayed in this hotel on two other occasions and liked it for both the price and its convenient location just 10 minutes away from the Ala Moana Shopping Center. Even though we had reserved a room with twin beds over three months earlier, they said that due to overbooking, they only had a king size bed available in the Marina Tower, but that they could provide a rollaway, which we agreed to. Well, the rollaway never appeared. We tried calling down to the front desk several times but the line was always busy. At it turns out, the telephone number listing pasted on the room phone was old. They had changed it from "2303" to "0" but had neglected to change the notice on the phone. My wife thus had to put up with me bouncing around on the king size bed all night as a result.Another problem was . . . cockroaches! Many were small but no matter how many we killed, the next time we looked, there were more! The next morning I found out that their rooms in the Marina Tower are simply condo apartments that the hotel manages. While there are regular pest treatments for the tower itself, the owners are responsile for their own apartments and many don't request regular fumigation. The result is the bugs just move around the building and are never completely exterminated.Oh, did I mention that there was only one elevator for the 36-floor tower? The other was 'out of order' due to the somewhat gusty winds. The winds had calmed down enough the next morning for them to start it up again, fortunately.The next morning we requested a move to the Equus Hotel proper, and were much happier campers there. The room was clean, although basic. For those who plan to use their computers in the room, there is free LAN service, but no WiFi. There is a single for-fee computer in the tiny lounge area on the main floor that you have to feed $1 bills if you want to print out your boarding pass, and there is even an extra charge for each page printed out. How chintzy can you get!Another small problem with the room is the shower. It is small, but adequate although there is no place to put your own shampoo and rinse except on the floor.

THE MARINA TOWER IS NO LONGER A PART OF THE EQUUS. CONS- When we arrived we thought that it didn't look very nice. You have to walk up a flight and a half of stairs to get to the main lobby. The elevator is right when you walk in so it felt like the staff doesn't have to communicate with you if they don't want to. We were really sad that there wasn't a hot tub. We came back from our first day of walking all day and all night and wanted to soak in the hot tub and they said it was apart of the "Marina Tower" an they no longer are apart of that. They have a teeny tiny pool that is freezing cold and it is shaded so you can't lay out in the sun. Another problem was hotel parking. We rented a car in the morning and then at night when we got back to the hotel there was 1 slot open. So we parked in it and went to tell them we were parked (it's $18 a night) and they said the lot was full for the night. They only had 8 parking slots for the whole hotel. We had to go to a parking garage across the street. It was okay but it was just inconvenient. and annoying. I asked in the morning if there was any open slots and they said they wouldn't know for awhile until someone checked out or returned the car. The hotel is right next to the street so the road noise was extremely loud.PROS- The room was fine. The mini fridge was nice so we could buy bottled water at the grocery store to save a little money. I say the room was nice because we were only in it at night to go to bed. It was a good location. Close to many fast food and restaurants, shopping and the beach.
second stay at the Marina Tower, the view from our room on the 37th floor was magnificent, the staff was professional and the manager Ms. Rene Kahumoku embodies the old Hawaiian elegance.

We haven't been to Hawaii in 25 years. We booked this hotel because of all the good reviews. The reviews were right. This is a gem. We got a penthouse suite in the Marina Tower with a beautiful view of the beach and ocean. The staff were very friendly and tended to our needs very quickly. We had the pool and tennis court to ourselves as not many people used those amenities. The location met our transpotation needs as the Ala Moana Center was a hub for many buses. You can't beat free continental breakfast and wired internet in the room. Wonderful memories, beautiful weather and I wish we could have stayed longer. Thank-you Rene, Puka and the rest of the staff for making our stay that much more special.

For the price we paid, this hotel was great. We were staying in Honolulu for 1 night prior to a 7 day cruise around the islands. Many of the hotels in Honolulu were 3 times the price we paid but knowing that we were just going to grab a few hours of sleep we didn't need all the perks! The Equus met our needs with a very comfortable bed and great access to public transportation. It's not the newest or on the beach - but it was a good value for the money.

The hotel and marina are separate structures- this should be clarified at time of booking. Otherwise location is great (lagoon, marina, highway and conference center close by), shopping district and main waikiki beach an enjoyable walk away; Marina tower has excellent views, comfortable rooms, overall enjoyable stay with competitive prices for this expensive area. Cutomer service excellent, in particular with an excellent and attentive manager, Renee.

A very friendly place to stay. Staff at the Waikiki Marina are great particularly the Security Guard Linelle who is always willing to help out and give advice about the area. Recommended and the views are great from the rooms.

I stayed at the hotel for 5 days and I can say it was a hit and miss experience. The hit was the view of the Ocean View room. The miss was that on day 2 I could smell cigarette smoke in my bathroom from one of the other rooms which was a owner occupied room. At this hotel the Marina Tower was both a hotel and a apartment complex. On day 3 I arrived back to my room to the smell of marijuana in my room. The smell was so strong it was unbearable. I called down to the desk and spoke to Rene who sent a maintenance guy to check out the smell. Once he got there and I opened the door the guy went "wow that's weed. He then went on the tell me that the guy next door to 3203 always gets high and the smell usually goes into the hallway.I requested and was then given a room at the Equus. No more ocean view and the room was the noisiest room you can imagine with construction going on outside the hotel all night long. For this inconvenience Renee the Manager called me to tell me that she would comp two nights of parking worth $36.00. What a frustrating stay and a way to lose a customer forever. Rene if you are reading this a unhappy customer tells at least 20 people about a bad experience. I will be doing my part to spread the word. The Equus Marina Tower is the worst hotel stay I have ever experienced.

By reading other reviews, I knew the hotel lobby might be a bit tricky to find. I did manage to find the parking lot for the Equus . . . let me tell you, it is a tight squeeze! I reserved a room in the Marina Tower which is located in the building behind the Equus hotel. The Marina tower also has its own parking lot and what appears to be a registration lobby, which was never manned the entire time I was there (around 15 hours). There were also two stalls for registration. On reflection, I realize now that that is where I should have parked, then walked over to the Equus hotel desk to check in. As it was, check-in went quickly and I was given a remote clicker to open the gate to the upper parking area in the Marina Tower. The layout is that the entrance to the Marina Tower lots comes before the entrance to the Equus hotel lot via a one-way street (actually two-way, but separated by a median that can't be crossed). So to get to the Marina Tower lot, I had to exit and either go around the block, or make two U turns at traffic lights to get turned around to approach the lots again.So finally, I get to the Marina tower lot and the remote clicker doesn't work in opening the gate. Am I in the right building? Yes! Fortunately, the normally un-manned front door had someone there. And that person was the one who programmed the remotes for the hotel guests. He did some fiddling around with the clicker and decided that I was given a clicker that was never programmed. I had to go back to the lobby to get a new remote. Finally, I was able to park and get into my room! Needless to say, I left the car in the lot and took the bus into Waikiki for dinner. Parking was $18/night, not $20 as I've read in other reviews.As for the room, it was on the 23rd floor. It was studio room on the smallish side, but I was there for just a night so this was not an issue for me. The room looks pretty much like what is shown at the hotel's website, so I was not surprised. The view was fairly nice -- that of other hotels, but with the occasional glimpse of the ocean and horizon, and a bit of the marina. I spent all of 1 minute looking at it. Actually, the view is really nice at night.The room had a small air conditioner that I thought would be unable to cool the room. It did the job adequately, thank goodness. Internet worked fine, not wireless though. I did not use the kitchenette or breakfast since I checked out before the breakfast was ready. The room had an amazing amount of storage for its size. The flooring was tiled in the kitchenette area and hardwood (nice!) in the bed area. The only drawback was room's proximity to the elevators. The elevators sounded like a muted jet plane going by at random times during the hour. Ever watch the Blue Angels (Navy/Marine) or the Thunderbirds (Air Force) at air shows? It kind of sounded like that. I ended up having to use the earplugs that I brought along.The front desk and the lobby is open 24 hours. I was able to print out my boarding pass for about $3 at the business center. Unless you plan on surfing the internet, do not use a credit card which demands a $5 minimum charge. Would I stay here again? For $85/night plus $18/night parking -- Yes, I would.

I stay at the Marina Towers penthouse between 8/20 - 8/27. First I want to start out by saying the room attendant (Fely) assigned to my suit was very helpful and showed a level of courtesy unapproachable by any other I have known in past stays in other hotels.I you are looking for a peaceful and enjoable hotel, I would recommend The Marina Towers. My kids stayed at the Equus Hotel next door and they loved it.The only recommendation I have is have the coffee shop open with better hours, because I drink coffee all day long and they would have generated a lot of revinue from my stay...lol!

We had a family vacation group consisting of grandparents from Japan plus grandparents, parents & a 3-year old girl from California All enjoyed our stay. The Marina Tower is conveniently located, has some very good views of the marina area, coast & city, and is staffed by a very pleasant, responsive group of people. Renee in particular, is someone we remember as being particularly friendly and helpful. We will definitely return.

The best thing about the Equus Hotel and Marina Tower is the staff, who perform their jobs with considerable aloha. The next best things are: affordable price, a location near a nice section of Waikiki Beach and the Ala Moana Mall, and a decent sized swimming pool and spa.This hotel is comprised of two separate buildings adjacent to each other. My wife and I stayed in the Marina Tower, which is a 40-story structure that rises from a relatively small footprint. Our floor contained four units that faced the ocean, and I assume that all the residential floors have a similar configuration. Rooms boast that they have a partial ocean view. The view gets better as you go higher, and our 38th floor unit afforded us a spectacular vista to the west.The quality of the units can vary because the hotel is actually a condo hotel with units individually owned. However, the staff try their best to accommodate to the visitor's needs. Our unit was quiet (except that we needed to keep the window air conditioner going almost all the time), and the bed was very comfortable. A continental breakfast is included (7:30 to 9:00 AM), but, if you're an early riser like us, don't bother waiting for it. Go out to enjoy the cooler early morning hours, and find a munch elsewhere.The pool and spa don't open until 9:00 AM, but it stays open until at least 9:00 PM, so you can relax after a grinding day in the city. We've stayed in Waikiki hotels that has pools the size of large bathtubs, so we really liked having access to one that allowed for some lap swimming.

After our long trip from California we were greeted by Rene at the front desk and our rooms were located in the Marina Tower. After checking into our room we found the view to be just beautiful of Ala Moana beach park. We had a kitchenette that had everything we needed to cook our meals on days we didn't want to go out to eat. Rene was very helpful, providing us with directions to get groceries, and restaurant advice - which included the North Shore Cafe that is located on the property. She also helped us to coordinate several different activites during our stay. She had great tips on local places to go to which gave us the local feel of the island. Her recommendations were invaluable to us and she made us feel part of the family. Fey the housekeeper always had a smile on her face as she took care of our room. We can't wait for our next vacation here since we found it a great centrally located place with great service and beautiful views.

My room at the Marina tower had everything I needed, fridge, mini stove...it was like having my own apartment in the middle of everything that's fun in town, with a view that took my breath away. Every night I would watch the sun set over the ocean with a view of the mountains and the night lights from town, every morning waking up to see the sun gleaming off the ocean as the city came to life. The great room was complimented by the hospitality of the staff. Rene Kahumoku at the front desk greets everyone with such warmth and aloha, you feel like a family member returning home! Whenever I needed anything, a staff member is right there. I needed extra towels, rang Athena at the desk- I barely hung up the phone before someone was at my door with fresh towels! One morning I had trouble getting out of the parking garage and Puka came right over to help me on my way. I had a great stay, and would go back any time!

First of all, the hotel location is walking distance to the ocean, the grand Ala Moana Shopping Center and Waikiki. The Marina Tower's scenic elevator is just the greatest and since we were in one of the top floors, the view was spectacular! Nothing beats waking up in the morning, opening up the drapes and look at the ocean view and the blue skies of Honolulu! The best connection is the Guest Services Manager, Rene Kahumoku who is all ALOHA! She is so pleasantly sweet and will accommodate you with anything you need. Most of the staff are great as well. And there's the free continental breakfast for both properties. We also had free parking, so that's another plus when you're in that side of town.

The hotel has great guess service and filled all my requests to the best of their ability. Rene Kahumoku the guest service manager was very help full with my room requests and changes. I would stay there again for sure.

I stayed in the West Marina tower with my girlfriend last month and the service is excellent!! This is my second time going to Hawaii and staying at West Marina Tower is the best decision we ever made. My room is always maintained clean and nice by the lady named Linelle. She is very friendly and nice! Me and my girlfriend travel all over the country and never met a very nice housekeeper like her. Who would know that a 2 1/2 star hotel will have a great employee like this.. She always make sure that our place is nice and clean and if we have any question, just let her know. I'm writing this comment to let everybody know that this is the best place to stay when you go to Hawaii!

review_body: In general, a clean room is all I need to be happy and I don't require too many thrills and frills. We went ahead and booked this room in spite of the poor reviews that we saw because we know not everyone is going to have a good experience no matter how they are taken care of.However, I will not recommend this hotel to any friends or family planning on going to Oahu nor will I stay here my next trip. We stayed 7 nights and the age of the building really shows in the rooms. We had to wait on the elevator upwards of 15 minutes the entire trip and sometimes the elevators didn't work at all. We went 2 nights without hot water and the staff did not seem to be concerned nor offer any concessions for the trouble. I assume this is due to the fact that this is not only a hotel but also maintains long term residents who they are probably used to dealing with being stuck in lease.The room itself did not reflect the pictures we saw online, the furniture was very dated, curtains filthy, windows filthy. The air conditioner was held together by duct tape and there was heavy water damage to the drywall and cabinetry in the bathroom and kitchenette that had never been addressed properly. Speaking of the bathroom, the shower is useless if you are at all big. Im 6'1" 190 and barely had enough space to bend over and wash my toes. Also, be aware of your booking confirmation information. Ours stated daily parking rates of $15.00/day and we were charged $18.00/day at check out.Forego any actual cleaning, the maid service was pretty good. We always seemed to get fresh towels as needed without asking and our bedding was changed twice during our stay. The hotel also offers free wired internet access in the room which was a plus for planning our days. The location of the hotel was a very short walk to Ala Moana Beach Park which is a spectacular option if you are having a tough time finding a place for your beach towel on Waikiki Beach.

my wife and i decided to get away from the house for a few days and the marina made it so enjoyable. its affordable and in a very convenient location. the staff are very friendly and i really appreciate the secured parking building.

My husband and I stayed in the Marina Tower ..We were upgraded to a King Ocean View on the 29th floor.....The View was great from our room..How ever ...The decor was red, peach, blue and sea green...The bathroom was small with a shower only...The kitchenette was 2 burners one had foil around it....A small fridge, and 1 sink...with no dish drainer... The cabinets had water damage...The grocery store is very expensive, its not worth getting a kitchenette...On the weekend days the hot water vanished, but returned on Monday..The Bed was very comfortable but the pillows were on the flat side....Walls are paper thin ,People on your floor of the tower can hear everything going on in your room when they step off the elevator !!! The Lobby people are not much help when it comes to Pizza delivery..And the continental breakfast is a joke....All bread products were very poor quality....Oh and the TV reception was not very good either. It is a 10 Min. walk to the beach and marketplace.....and The bus is 5 min away and costs $2.50 one way with 1 free transfer.....
We had a pleasant 2 weeks in the Marina Tower, the staff was friendly, courteous and efficient. We will return. Nicole & Renzo (Vancouver B.C.)

So.... The pictures on the internet that are shown while talking about the Tower City/Ocean Views, are NOT what you will get... also is a LIE, when it says it comes with a flat panel TV... The TV we had in our room was the exact tube TV that we bought in 1995. The carpet looked like it was getting ready to be pulled up (there were NO base boards, and a gap between the carpet and the wall, Frayed and pulling.) THE VIEW WAS AMAZING!!!!!... and I loved being able to sleep with the giant window open... The bathroom was small and cramped, but I guess it served it's purpose.  I had asked for an upgrade, when I had researched the Marina tower on like, My Partner and My brithday, and our anniversary fell on our vacation, and I had sent an e-mail, requesting.. A nicer room, and I would have even paid for the upgrade. I just wanted comfort and quality over View, and Kitchenette. I had been told to Request again within a week of arrival... So I had sent off another a week before we arrived, and I had NO response.. Nadda ... NOTHING... and when I had arrived I had NO UPGRADE, and There Was NO flat panel TV in my room like the sight says when you book. One Morning I was in the lobby using my computer, and The front desk person over the radio , was angrily cussing at another employee... UNACCEPTABLE. There is NO walkway between the Eqqus, and the Marina Tower, yes it is two different buildings. You will have to drag your baggage through a gravel garden and 2 parking lots to get to the Marina Tower. The Pool in the Hotel is small and freezing... The Continental breakfast, ha... I came down at 8:30am... they had already ran out of EVERYTHING.... I was told by the employee working it that all that was left at 8:30AM was Toast, and butter.... But there is a Cafe in the Marina Tower's parking lot that Is Charming and Cozy, and you will get exceptional service, Pretty good food, and make some new friends.  Most of the houskeeping/security staff is very nice, and tries to help when they can... Front desk seemed to be swamped with complaints when I went though the lobby. And most of the time seemed VERY uncaring or cold of people's needs... what it seemed they cared about WAS the BOTTOM DOLLAR, and everything would be a charge.] As I found, my bed was not made or changed the first 3 days of 7 days. The bathroom remained a mess, yet a new bar of soap appeared on the tub everyday. If you want your linens changed it will cost you... The elevator was not working 2 times while I as there.... and staying on the 23rd floor that kind of sucks. And I don't know what the deal was, but as I was talking to others at the "buffet (very loosely)" We all seemed no NOT have had hot water first thing in the morning.  As negative as most of the HOTEL experience was I really enjoyed Oahu, and will be coming back again next year.... Eqqus and Marina tower, Definitely has potential, and MAYBE if they get their act together and straighten up, I would stay with them again next year.

I do not recommend this hotel if going to honolulu on vacation, or business for that matter. The photos on the internet are a complete misrepresentation of the rooms. The surfaces of every picture on the wall, bed frame, and tables had a layer of dust on it that had to have been building for the last few weeks if not months. Overall the interior of the room was run down and out dated. The floors under the cabinet lips had dirt built up on the floor. Just overall not a very clean place. We stayed in the Marina Tower on the 32nd floor, I will have to say we had an awesome view of the ocean. So on our 2nd night there we get woke up from a dead sleep at 1:30am in the morning to the fire alarm going off. We book down 32 flights of stairs in a panic thinking the building is on fire, it took 45 mins for the fire dept. to get there. Once they finally showed up we waited an hour and half for them to try and figure out what was going on, needless to say there never was a fire, they never did find out why the alarm went off. Then the elevators shut down, at which time we had to walk back up 32 flights of stairs at 3am in the morning. The hotel never once appologized for the inconvenience or offered any sort of compensation. When we went to check out I spoke with management inquiring if we could be refunded for the night due to the inconvenience, her reply was "Thats not going to happen". In short I don't not recommend this hotel!

Initially, was gonna stay in Equus hotel, but street noise was too much. However, wethought room was clean and a good value.Ended up on 37th floor of Marina Tower. Again, room was clean and nice. Granite floors and counter tops. And great view.Negatives were things outside of room were not as good. Entrance was kinda shabby. Things in general seemed a little cramped outside of room. No "do not disturb sign" so no way to signal cleaning lady to not knock on door in morning.In spite of the negatives, I would still stay here as it's a good value. Earlier in trip we stayed across street at the Prince, and it did not have the negatives, but cost alot more. Room and view more than made up for it.

The Equus Hotel & Marina Tower is the worst hotel I ever stayed. They might be good on the Equus Hotel part, but absolutely not for the Marina Tower. When I book this hotel, I checked their website and look through their photos to make sure the rooms are in good condition. Of course everything looks perfect on the website, but the truth is that they did not sure anything about this Marina Tower. The rooms at Marina Tower are outdated and I have to call the front desk and waited 15 minutes for a hairdryer. Also, on the second day of my vacation, the elevator was broken and they asked me to climb the stairs. I was on the 21st floor. It was just a nightmare and I changed the hotel next day.

I booked a room through AAA. When I checked in I was informed I'd be staying in the Marina Tower. This was not what I planned on, I researched a lot of hotels before deciding on this one, but was open minded. I should have known by the tone of the clerks voice what I was in for. At first I didn't think it was so bad because I had stayed here a few years ago with my mom and had a great room on the 32nd floor. I believe these are independently owned which would explain my disappointment. I got a key to a room on the 10th floor. This tower seemed nearly abandoned, the former office was closed and one of the elevators was not operating. There was a shady looking gentleman that appeared to be homeless sitting in the lobby and another man got on the elevator with me. As an afterthought the shady looking man got in the elevator with us. I was traveling alone so hesitated to push the button to my floor until they both pushed theirs. The man hesitated, which scared me. I got off at my floor and opened the door to my room. One word, scary. The walls were nearly bare, the furniture was old, cheap and sparce, the room appeared less than clean. I turned on the light to the bathroom with hesitation and a horrible screeching noise that sounded like a small animal made me scream, it turned out to be a squeaky exhaust fan. My cell phone had no reception at all on this floor. The view was of a close by apartment building. The coffee pot looked dirty. I sat on the bed for a second and it was hard as a rock. I didn't even set my bags down. I went downstairs, gave my key back and asked if I would be charged for the second night I booked if I left now, giving up on what I'd already paid for the first night. He said I wouldn't be charged, but when I got my credit card statement a month later I was there, charged for both nights. It didn't matter, I wouldn't stay there and wont go back. I felt unsafe. The room seemed cheap and dirty. I have traveled alone a LOT to Waikiki and surrounding areas but this was my worst experience. The hotel has really gone downhill.
Special thanks to maintenance Linelle in Marina Tower for good , friendly and fast service.Alla , AlexSeattle

Being world travellers, and on our 2nd. round-the-world trip, we have been staying in very many different types of accomodation around the world. Usually we do not have time to write reviews of places we have stayed at, but this time we feel we have to speak out of our experiences at the Equus. We had earlier browsed different hotel websites about this so-called boutique hotel where they comment positive about this place. Since there were just 2 options of rooms at the Marina Tower(city or ocean view), we booked a doble room, city view requesting one on a higher floor.But the whole truth dawned on us when we checked in....First of all, tower room city view is a “low-rated” standard room with a kitchenett, only up to 14th. floor, with no view at all. City veiw means neighbouring blocks looking right into your window!Secondly, the room was not very clean. The kitchenett drawers and cupboards were sticky and oily, so was the microwave...urrghhh! There was just one fork and a spoon(no knives at all), a very dented frying pan (looked like it was picked up from a rubbish dump), 2 small chipped saucers that were supposed to be plates??, and a coffee machine. Best of all, the toilet bowl was loose, such that when you sit on it, it wipped! We went down to complain, and was informed that they would send maintainence to look at it. Otherwise they would set in the utensils we needed in the kitchenette for our stay. We requested a change of room three days in a row, since we felt that the room we had was the worst in that block – microwave dirty and outdated, old TV, coffee machine leaked everytime you made coffee, windows could not be opened so it smelled musty etc..The 5 options we got were no better – all were just standard rooms with two single beds, only with more updated microwave and TV (flatscreen). And since they had no dobble rooms available, we were stuck with the one we had. What really got us was the attitude of the lady in charge at the reception – Renee- she was not at all nice, and told us that if we were not satisfied, we can just find ourselves another hotel! (We had booked and prepaid the room for 11 days at a hotelwebsite, so there’s no refund for us) So we decided to make the most of our stay there, and as the days passed, we noted all of the things that put this so-called boutique hotel on the “worst hotels” list. The room was not cleaned at all throughout the 11 days we were there.They only made up the bed, emptied the rubbish bin, and when they changed towels, the “new”towels had brown stains on them. Once they changed the over-sheet, and that too had 3 huge brownish stains on it! So we just folded it in two - we’d given up complaining.A coffee sachet was put in the room only on the first day. We were informed that if we wanted coffee, we had first to ring reception, who then sends housekeeping with a coffee sachet to us. This we had to do even when we asked for coffee while housekeeping was right outside the door! Terribly rigide rules.So... the ONLY positive thing about this hotel is it’s location, and the new girl “Mimie” at the reception. She understood our plight, and tried to do her best, but there was little she could do, being new and not having authority to make changes.So...to all fellow travellers – be warned.. don't beleive the photos and comments of the different websites concerning this hotel. Outside it looks very nice, but on the inside...... KEEP AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!

I stayed at the Marina Towers in Waikiki recently for an interview at UH. Pros:1) Great view2) Studio-style with kitchenette for those interested in light cookingCons:1) Terrifying elevator! It' a glass box outdoors. It made me nervous at first, but when I overheard other guests saying that it's illegal to keep elevator cables outdoors and that they were extremely rusty it didn't do anything to calm my fears. I would have been happy to give up the great view for a ground-floor room, but nothing was available.2) Very simple, clean but don't expect any luxury.3) Poor mattress and linen quality. Don't expect to get a great night's sleep if you need a moderate or better quality mattress to sleep well.4) Parking is an additional $18 per day.

The reviews we read about the Equus Hotel and Marina Tower seem accurate. It was as expected. We stayed in the Marina Tower with a deluxe ocean view on a high floor. It is obviously an older building, but the rehab was well done. The room was clean and comfortable. The view was great. And the location was convenient between the Ala Wai canal and Waikiki Beach.The hotel is not located right on the beach. It is across Ala Moana Blvd, about a block away, but its an easy walk. The Waikiki strip, resort hotels, high end shops and restaurants, are about a twenty minute walk. (Beware: parking in the area is expensive and difficult) The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, but skip the continental breakfast, it is not worth the trouble.The room had a small kitchenette, although we only used the refrigerator. The built in cabinets throughout were older and not updated, the the floors and bathroom tiles were new. The king size bed was comfortable. The was a large, wall mounted flat screen TV with cable and high speed internet via ethernet.Check in was difficult. The front desk and lobby are located up one flight of stairs from the street level in the Equus building. We arrived with two large suitcases and carry ons which we dragged up the stairs to check in. We then dragged them down the stairs to head to our room in the tower building. It was inconvenient, but not a major drama.This is definitely not a luxury hotel like the Edition (located across the street) with rooms starting at $350 a night. But, if you're looking for a good value, this works.

Well, if you just need a place to stay close to the Ala Wai boat harbor. located on Ala Moana Blvd., a very busy street with lots of noise. Very dated rooms but have a nice view from the marina tower.

The best thing about our room at the Equus was the view. We did not stay in the main Equus building, but in the Marina Tower on the 38th floor. The view was absolutely amazing, and made any short comings of the room unimportant. Our room had a kitchenette, which was small but would be perfect for an extended stay. the fridge smelled terrible, and there were little bugs in it, but a word to the front desk and they cleaned it out right away. This was not such a big deal, because we didn't end up using it for anything. The room was shaped awkwardly, with the bed and computer desk squeezed into one side which made it hard to walk around. The bathroom was small but adequate, but the overall appearance made you think "cheap remodel". The bed was comfortable, and waking up to that view was so amazing. It is hard to think badly about the room with that view. And, you don't go to Oahu to stay in your hotel room so it is easy to write off the oddness of the room. This hotel is in an excellent location, right across the street from the marina and Waikiki beach. There are great restaurants in walking distance, and an ABC store on the same block which is great for a cheap breakfast. The Equus offers a free breakfast, but we were always leaving too early to enjoy.

The hotel has a great location right across from the Ala Wai Marina. We stayed in the tower and had an amazing view of the harbor and city skyline. The rooms are old and outdated.The staff was barely noticeable , not even a good morning when coming down for breakfast.Continental breakfast is included in the roomrate. The room was small and includes a small kitchenette. The hotel is right on a busy street so there is a lot of noise from the road. Overall this hotel does do for a quick business trip, would not recommend for an extended vacation.

We looked at The Equus website before choosing to book accomodation there. 'A boutique hotel'...i'm sure The Equus is, however The Marina Tower couldn't be more different.Basically, the accomodation consists of two locations. The Equus Hotel, and then just behind it The Marina Tower, which is also part of The Equus.I have copied the segment below from the hotels website........"With the addition of the Marina Tower, an award winning architectural landmark with glass elevators soaring 40 stories high, providing spectacular panoramic ocean views from many of its 136 guestrooms, the new Equus Hotel & Marina Tower is a stylish one-of-a- kind property located just steps from the world-renowned Waikiki Beach."This is VERY MISLEADING. The 'sprinkling of Ralph Lauren inspired touches' does not exist in The Marina Tower.What they fail to mention is that the Marina Tower is very dated, and in much need of a complete makeover. IT LOOKS NOTHING LIKE THE ROOMS IN THE EQUUS!!!After looking at the website, i made the mistake of booking a room in The Marina Tower. I booked a room with two double beds, city view. On arrival we were told they had no rooms left with two double beds, that they only had a room with two single beds, but they had upgraded us to a Sea View. Not a problem..................until we entered the room.The best way i can think to describe the room is like a hostel. Something that you wouldn't mind paying £20 a night for. It had two tatty single beds, with a sheet on each and scummy looking pillows. Dated rotting wooden furniture, a yellow 'curtain' that would not keep any light out, and a lumpy old TV.I made my way back over to the Reception in The Equus and we were given keys to two other rooms to have a look at. We picked one of those, it was marginally better with a double bed and better curtains. It had a kitchenette that we didn't risk using as it just looked dirty, it smelt of damp, the walls in the bathroom were crumbling, and there were quite a few coackroaches!We had to endure a week here. The room was not cleaned, apart from the bin being emptied. By the 5th day we had to yet again go to Reception to ask for some clean towels and for the bed sheets to be changed and they stated it would be done the following day - it wasn't. BACK to reception to ask AGAIN, and two girls came to the room shortly after with some towels that smelt like they had been in a boiler room.The view was fantastic, but i didn't want to spend any time in the room to enjoy it.Some of the 'apartments' at Marina Tower are privately owned. Everytime i got in the lift there would be someone drunk out of their head and stinking of alcohol, at all times of day. Lets just say that some of the residents aren't societies most desirable people.All 3 washers and 2 dryers broke down whilst we were there.On the upside a free breakfast was provided over at The Equus which consisted of Melon, pastries, juice and coffee which was fine.Jackie who was the security/housekeeping lady was a very pleasant lady. She is an asset to The Equus and i hope they appreciate her. She deserves to work in a better environment and im sure would benefit from a lot more tips!The lady who provided the breakfast was also very pleasant.I tried not to let our stay ruin our time in Oahu, but i must admit i dreaded going back to Marina Tower each night to sleep.I will never stay again, even if it were in The Equus part of the hotel, as i feel in a way i have been conned out of my money.The location is good for Ala Moana Beach and Shopping Centre, close to buses/trolleys and not too far to Waikiki.
Had an excellent stay at the marinated towers. In house staff member Linelle was very helpful. She told me where to go in waikiki and where to find the best deals for shopping.

I booked the Equus Hotel after reading the reviews that I've read on the web. But their website showed a nice room so I wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt. I arrived at the hotel after driving a few times around the block because the entrance was difficult to find. When I checked in, I didn't get a room at the Equus but the Marina or whatever it was. We went the the room and it was nothing near the pictures on the web. The floor was greasy and it smelled like someone was cooking with oil in the room. There was no bath tub. Just a tiled shower room. I was grossed out and just stayed there one night and moved to another hotel. The sheets were stained so I had to use a towel to cover the stained area before getting into bed. I guess I couldn't expect much for the price, but this was a room that would be on my never want to visit list. Lesson learned -- When you read the reviews, they are true. If you just want a cheap place to stay and don't mind the greasy floors and outdated and unkempt rooms, then this is the place to be. If you want a reasonably clean place to stay, then don't even consider it. I'm glad I made the move. I didn't even want to ask them why they didn't have a room in the Equus because the other reviews I read are all similar. Book the Equus and get a room in the Marina.I don't recommend this place to anyone. The website said it had free wi-fi but it didn't. It didn't even have a hair dryer. So I asked for one and they said that they would send it up. I never got one.I hope this review will help others.

I relied on the tripadvisor comments when I booked the hotel in SFO. When I came here I was really shocked. The hotel is not at all what I expected from the website, pictures in the internet. The reports in trip advisor cant be real. I do really doubt that. The photos do not correspond at all. There are rooms in the Marina Tower which are really old and dirty. The doors do not work properly. The staff at the reception is very unfriendly and the only nice person is the lady who is preparing the breakfast. If you ask a question they don't even try to help you. Worst of all is that the rooms are really dirty. There is dust all over the place and the furniture is old and broken. Seems like nobody ever cleans them apart from a quick vacuum. The 2nd day they didnt even bother to change the towels anymore. If you call the reception they dont care and tell you that you should call the next day. The so called breakfast consists of bread and some fruits. That is all! It is also only served from 7.30-8.30 am. Anyway, it is not worth going there anyway. All I can say is that Im really disappointed and I would never stay in something like this again. We payed 1000$ for one week of which the flight was only one third. This hotel is not at all what you expect.

I booked the hotel through our travel site. This Hotel is Equus Hotel and Marina Tower. Beware of where they are putting you. All photos are of the Equus Hotel portion of the property. The "And Marina Tower" is VERY VERY NASTY. The rooms have not been updated it appears since the 70's, the shower is musty, the bathroom so small that using the toilet required bending way forward due to the coutertop passing behind and over the toilet.This is an over 30 story building with only one working elevator. I had wait times wxceeding 15 minutes on the elevator. SOme people live in the building and reported that the elevator has been out of service since March. Based on the condition of everything else it was no suprise.I was only staying three nights, they have a 48 hr. cancellation policy. This meant that I could NOT do anything about the remaining two days once I checked in. Parking $18.00 per night. All in all I would have preferred a Motel 6. I wouldn't reccomend this to an enemy.There was no indication of these conditions on their website or in any reports. It may be that the Equus is fine but ensure you are not in the Marina Tower..... Horrible.

When we checked into the Equus hotel, they gave us a room in the Marina Tower facing the ocean on the 35th floor and the view was spectacular. Wow, the windows opened the entire length of the unit and we loved the wonderful breezes coming into the room. We weren't too crazy about the kitchenette and bathroom in the room (needs updating) but everything works. We are especially happy with the services provided by the hotel. We have a really GREAT housekeeper, Linelle, who is so friendly and efficient. I think this is the best deal in all of Waikiki.

we booked a room with kitchenette and only later realized that the room was not in the equus hotel but in the adjacent marina tower which is quite dated. wasn't a problem however and as we arrived we got upgraded to an ocean view room. the room was clean, spacious and with great view. the kitchenette was equipped for preparing simple meals and perfectly adequate for a short stay. the only down was the elevator, one was under repair and therefore it took a while to get up to/down from the 33rd floor. the pool behind the tennis court is nice but overshadowed most of the day. the location near the shopping center is convenient. a short walk will get you to the beach so all in all it is a good, no frills choice for your stay. we paid $75 plus tax a night.

Where do I start...We were in room 3003, the best I can say is the views. The room was shanty and dirty. It had black electrical tape holding in the air conditioner, the drapes were ripped and shredded, and the WORSE part was the toilet, it had a counter behind it so you could not sit on it straight, you had to lean forward. Out of the 7 days we stayed there we had room service for 1 day, there was no toilet paper, the towels or sheets were never changed. The elevator...oh my...what a nightmare, you could wait for 15 minutes for it to come, and it was full so you had to wait for the next time. I had to go down the 30 FLIGHTS of stairs numerous times, so I was not late for my scheduled plans for the day. The worse is waiting for that elevator and then finally making it up to the 30th floor to find the door key was not working and go back down to the lobby. On some days they had two elevators working but by afternoon it was broken again, this happened most of the week. The front clerk was a young guy, who really had no concern over the dirty rooms, toilet situation and alls he keep saying was, I know I have to deal with it too...good answer, no reason why the house keepers did not clean the room. When I go back, I will defiantly not stay here again. The bed was old, hard and lumpy. If you stay good luck and remember not to take room 3002!!!

I would NEVER ever stay at this hotel again. There are 40 stories to this hotel and only one working elevator. My husband and I spent a large portion of our vacation waiting for the only elevator to take us up to our room on the 22nd floor. I booked a room for a week through cheaptickets.com (big mistake) and my credit card was charged for the entire week as soon as we checked in, so I couldn't afford to switch hotels. The management actually told us it was going to take 14 weeks to fix the other elevator!!! They were unwilling to compensate us in any way for the huge inconvenience of waiting for all of the housekeepers, maintenance workers and other guests to use the same very small elevator (Jam packed this elevator could hold maybe seven or eight people at the most). Also, when we checked in we were not told about having to pay to park our rented car in their garage. Upon check out we recieved a bill for an extra $100!! Again, we called the management who were willing to do nothing other than say sorry. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone except maybe to my worst enemy!

We arrived at the Polo Inn and checked in- and found out that we were staying in the "Aqua Marina Resort" which was located just behind the polo inn. It cost us $12.50 a day to park in the parking garage, which was built around the Aqua Marina resort and then we only had a handful of open spots that were designated for the Hawaii Polo Inn. We were quite unimpressed with the accomidations. The biggest issues we had were with the design of the bathroom- it was sort of triangular in shape, and had a low counter that ran diagonally across the top of the toliet, which made using the toliet an interesting experience- since you could not sit up straight, but must lean forward. Overall it was old and run down and it appeared as though our door, and our neighbor's door had been broken into more than once judging by the amount of damage to the door and the door frame. Unfortunately this is the portion of the trip in which I had pink-eye and felt not well enough to do a lot of activities, so we spent much more time in this hotel than anyone could ever want to.On the positive side It was clean, and the cleaning staff was very helpful and considerate. We did have to make a point of calling the correct front desk though since we were not paying the Aqua Marina but the Polo Inn.We wouldn't ever book this place on purpose- it was arranged for as a "free gift" for attending some time share presentation we attended. That being said, we know that beggers can't be choosers... and we didn't have a choice! But we would never stay here again as long as we are in control of choosing the location.
